   20: -module(global_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -compile(r24). % many_nodes()
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, 
   25: 	 init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   26:          init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   27:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   28: 
   29: 	 names/1, names_hidden/1, locks/1, locks_hidden/1,
   30: 	 bad_input/1, names_and_locks/1, lock_die/1, name_die/1,
   31: 	 basic_partition/1, basic_name_partition/1,
   32: 	 advanced_partition/1, stress_partition/1,
   33: 	 ring/1, simple_ring/1, line/1, simple_line/1,
   34: 	 global_lost_nodes/1, otp_1849/1,
   35: 	 otp_3162/1, otp_5640/1, otp_5737/1,
   36:          connect_all_false/1, 
   37:          simple_disconnect/1, 
   38:          simple_resolve/1, simple_resolve2/1, simple_resolve3/1,
   39:          leftover_name/1, re_register_name/1, name_exit/1, external_nodes/1,
   40:          many_nodes/1, sync_0/1,
   41: 	 global_groups_change/1,
   42: 	 register_1/1,
   43: 	 both_known_1/1,
   44:          lost_unregister/1,
   45: 	 mass_death/1,
   46: 	 garbage_messages/1,
   47:          ring_line/1,
   48:          flaw1/1,
   49:          lost_connection/1,
   50:          lost_connection2/1,
   51:          global_disconnect/1
   52:         ]).
   53: 
   54: %% Not used
   55: -export([config_dc/4,
   56:          w/2,
   57:          check_same/2,
   58:          check_same/1,
   59:          stop/0,
   60:          start_nodes_serially/3]).
   61: 
   62: -export([lock_global/2, lock_global2/2]).
   63: 
   64: -export([
   65:          %% Called via ?RES
   66:          resolve_none/3,
   67:          resolve_first/3,
   68:          resolve_second/3,
   69:          bad_resolver/3,
   70:          badrpc_resolver/3,
   71:          lock_resolver/3,
   72:          exit_resolver/3,
   73:          disconnect_first/3,
   74:          halt_second/3,
   75:          init_mass_spawn/1,
   76: 
   77:          %% Called via rpc_cast
   78:          crash/1,
   79:          single_node/2,
   80:          alone/2,
   81:          global_load/3,
   82: 
   83:          %% Called via rpc:call
   84:          halt_node/1,
   85:          start_proc/0, start_proc/1,
   86:          start_proc2/1,
   87:          start_proc3/1,
   88:          start_proc4/1,
   89:          start_proc_basic/1,
   90:          start_resolver/2,
   91: 
   92:          %% Called as a fun (fun ?MODULE:function/x) 
   93:          fix_basic_name/3,
   94: 
   95:          %% Called via spawn
   96:          init_proc_basic/2,
   97:          init_2/0,
   98:          p_init/1, p_init/2,
   99:          p_init2/2
  100: 
  101:         ]).
  102: 
  103: -export([start_tracer/0, stop_tracer/0, get_trace/0]).
  104: 
  105: %% Exports for error_logger handler
  106: -export([init/1, handle_event/2, handle_info/2, handle_call/2, terminate/2]).
  107: 
  108: 
  109: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
  110: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
  111: 
  112: -define(NODES, [node()|nodes()]).
  113: 
  114: -define(UNTIL(Seq), loop_until_true(fun() -> Seq end, Config, 1)).
  115: 
  116: %% The resource used by the global module.
  117: -define(GLOBAL_LOCK, global).
  118: 
  119: %% -define(DBG(T), erlang:display({{self(), ?MODULE, ?LINE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}, T})).
  120: 
  121: 
  122: suite() ->
  123:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  124: 
  125: all() -> 
  126:     case init:get_argument(ring_line) of
  127: 	{ok, _} -> [ring_line];
  128: 	_ ->
  129: 	    [
  130:              names, names_hidden, locks, locks_hidden, bad_input,
  131: 	     names_and_locks, lock_die, name_die, basic_partition,
  132: 	     advanced_partition, basic_name_partition,
  133: 	     stress_partition, simple_ring, simple_line, ring, line,
  134: 	     global_lost_nodes, otp_1849, otp_3162, otp_5640,
  135: 	     otp_5737, connect_all_false, simple_disconnect, simple_resolve,
  136: 	     simple_resolve2, simple_resolve3, leftover_name,
  137: 	     re_register_name, name_exit, external_nodes, many_nodes,
  138: 	     sync_0, global_groups_change, register_1, both_known_1,
  139: 	     lost_unregister, mass_death, garbage_messages, flaw1,
  140:              lost_connection, lost_connection2, global_disconnect
  141:             ]
  142:     end.
  143: 
  144: groups() -> 
  145:     [{ttt, [],
  146:       [names, names_hidden, locks, locks_hidden, bad_input,
  147:        names_and_locks, lock_die, name_die, basic_partition,
  148:        ring]}].
  149: 
  150: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  151:     Config.
  152: 
  153: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  154:     Config.
  155: 
  156: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  157:     Config.
  158: 
  159: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  160:     ok.
  161: 
  162: 
  163: -define(TESTCASE, testcase_name).
  164: -define(testcase, proplists:get_value(?TESTCASE, Config)).
  165: -define(nodes_tag, '$global_nodes').
  166: -define(registered, proplists:get_value(registered, Config)).
  167: 
  168: init_per_testcase(Case, Config0) when is_atom(Case) andalso is_list(Config0) ->
  169:     start_node_tracker(Config0),
  170: 
  171:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  172:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  173:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  174:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  175:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  176:        [Config0, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  177: 
  178:     ok = gen_server:call(global_name_server,
  179:                          high_level_trace_start,
  180:                          infinity),
  181: 
  182:     Config1 = [{?TESTCASE, Case}, {registered, registered()} | Config0],
  183: 
  184:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  185:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  186:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  187:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  188:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [Config1, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  189: 
  190:     Config1.
  191: 
  192: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  193:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  194:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  195:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  196:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  197:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  198:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  199: 
  200:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  201:     _ = gen_server:call(global_name_server, high_level_trace_stop, infinity),
  202:     [global:unregister_name(N) || N <- global:registered_names()],
  203:     InitRegistered = ?registered,
  204:     Registered = registered(),
  205: 
  206:     [?P("end_per_testcase -> "
  207:         "~n   ~s local names: ~p", [What, N]) ||
  208: 	{What, N} <- [{"Added", Registered -- InitRegistered},
  209: 		      {"Removed", InitRegistered -- Registered}],
  210: 	N =/= []],
  211: 
  212:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  213:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  214:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  215:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  216:        [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  217: 
  218:     stop_node_tracker(Config). %% Needs to be last and produce return value...
  219: 
  220: %%% General comments:
  221: %%% One source of problems with failing tests can be that the nodes from the
  222: %%% previous test haven't died yet.
  223: %%% So, when stressing a particular test by running it in a loop, it may
  224: %%% fail already when starting the help nodes, even if the nodes have been
  225: %%% monitored and the nodedowns picked up at the previous round. Waiting
  226: %%% a few seconds between rounds seems to solve the problem. Possibly the
  227: %%% timeout of 7 seconds for connections can also be a problem. This problem
  228: %%% is the same with old (vsn 3) and new global (vsn 4).
  229: 
  230: 
  231: %%% Test that register_name/2 registers the name on all nodes, even if
  232: %%% a new node appears in the middle of the operation (OTP-3552).
  233: %%%
  234: %%% Test scenario: process p2 is spawned, locks global, starts a slave node,
  235: %%% and tells the parent to do register_name. Then p2 sleeps for five seconds
  236: %%% and releases the lock. Now the name should exist on both our own node
  237: %%% and on the slave node (we wait until that is true; it seems that we
  238: %%% can do rpc calls to another node before the connection is really up).
  239: register_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  240:     Timeout = 15,
  241:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  242:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  243:     init_condition(Config),
  244:     P = spawn_link(?MODULE, lock_global, [self(), Config]),
  245:     receive
  246: 	{P, ok} ->
  247: 	    io:format("p1: received ok~n"),
  248: 	    ok
  249:     end,
  250:     P ! step2,
  251:     io:format("p1: sent step2~n"),
  252:     yes = global:register_name(foo, self()),
  253:     io:format("p1: registered~n"),
  254:     P ! step3,
  255:     receive
  256: 	{P, I, I2} ->
  257: 	    ok
  258:     end,
  259:     if
  260: 	I =:= I2 ->
  261: 	    ok;
  262: 	true ->
  263: 	    ct:fail({notsync, I, I2})
  264:     end,
  265:     _ = global:unregister_name(foo),
  266:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  267:     init_condition(Config),
  268:     ok.
  269: 
  270: lock_global(Parent, Config) ->
  271:     Id = {global, self()},
  272:     io:format("p2: setting lock~n"),
  273:     global:set_lock(Id, [node()]),
  274:     Parent ! {self(), ok},
  275:     io:format("p2: sent ok~n"),
  276:     receive
  277: 	step2 ->
  278: 	    io:format("p2: received step2"),
  279: 	    ok
  280:     end,
  281:     io:format("p2: starting slave~n"),
  282:     {ok, Host} = inet:gethostname(),
  283:     {ok, N1} = slave:start(Host, node1),
  284:     io:format("p2: deleting lock~n"),
  285:     global:del_lock(Id, [node()]),
  286:     io:format("p2: deleted lock~n"),
  287:     receive
  288: 	step3 ->
  289: 	    ok
  290:     end,
  291:     io:format("p2: received step3~n"),
  292:     I = global:whereis_name(foo),
  293:     io:format("p2: name ~p~n", [I]),
  294:     ?UNTIL(I =:= rpc:call(N1, global, whereis_name, [foo])),
  295:     I2 = I,
  296:     slave:stop(N1),
  297:     io:format("p2: name2 ~p~n", [I2]),
  298:     Parent ! {self(), I, I2},
  299:     ok.
  300: 
  301: %%% Test for the OTP-3576 problem: if nodes 1 and 2 are separated and
  302: %%% brought together again, while keeping connection with 3, it could
  303: %%% happen that if someone temporarily held the 'global' lock,
  304: %%% 'try_again_locker' would be called, and this time cause both 1 and 2
  305: %%% to obtain a lock for 'global' on node 3, which would keep the
  306: %%% name registry from ever becoming consistent again.
  307: both_known_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  308:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
  309:         true ->
  310:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions enabled"};
  311:         false ->
  312:             both_known_1_test(Config)
  313:     end.
  314: 
  315: both_known_1_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  316:     Timeout = 30,
  317:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  318:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  319:     init_condition(Config),
  320: 
  321:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
  322: 
  323:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2, cp3], slave, Config),
  324: 
  325:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  326: 
  327:     rpc_disconnect_node(Cp1, Cp2, Config),
  328: 
  329:     {_Pid1, yes} = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, [p1]),
  330:     {_Pid2, yes} = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc, [p2]),
  331: 
  332:     Names10 = rpc:call(Cp1, global, registered_names, []),
  333:     Names20 = rpc:call(Cp2, global, registered_names, []),
  334:     Names30 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, registered_names, []),
  335: 
  336:     Names1 = Names10 -- OrigNames,
  337:     Names2 = Names20 -- OrigNames,
  338:     Names3 = Names30 -- OrigNames,
  339: 
  340:     [p1] = lists:sort(Names1),
  341:     [p2] = lists:sort(Names2),
  342:     [p1, p2] = lists:sort(Names3),
  343: 
  344:     Locker = spawn(Cp3, ?MODULE, lock_global2, [{global, l3},
  345: 						self()]),
  346: 
  347:     receive
  348: 	{locked, S} ->
  349: 	    true = S
  350:     end,
  351: 
  352:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp2]),
  353: 
  354:     %% Bring cp1 and cp2 together, while someone has locked global.
  355:     %% They will now loop in 'loop_locker'.
  356: 
  357:     Names10_2 = rpc:call(Cp1, global, registered_names, []),
  358:     Names20_2 = rpc:call(Cp2, global, registered_names, []),
  359:     Names30_2 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, registered_names, []),
  360: 
  361:     Names1_2 = Names10_2 -- OrigNames,
  362:     Names2_2 = Names20_2 -- OrigNames,
  363:     Names3_2 = Names30_2 -- OrigNames,
  364: 
  365:     [p1] = lists:sort(Names1_2),
  366:     [p2] = lists:sort(Names2_2),
  367:     [p1, p2] = lists:sort(Names3_2),
  368: 
  369:     %% Let go of the lock, and expect the lockers to resolve the name
  370:     %% registry.
  371:     Locker ! {ok, self()},
  372: 
  373:     ?UNTIL(begin
  374: 	       Names10_3 = rpc:call(Cp1, global, registered_names, []),
  375: 	       Names20_3 = rpc:call(Cp2, global, registered_names, []),
  376: 	       Names30_3 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, registered_names, []),
  377: 
  378: 	       Names1_3 = Names10_3 -- OrigNames,
  379: 	       Names2_3 = Names20_3 -- OrigNames,
  380: 	       Names3_3 = Names30_3 -- OrigNames,
  381: 
  382: 	       N1 = lists:sort(Names1_3),
  383: 	       N2 = lists:sort(Names2_3),
  384: 	       N3 = lists:sort(Names3_3),
  385: 	       (N1 =:= [p1, p2]) and (N2 =:= [p1, p2]) and (N3 =:= [p1, p2])
  386: 	   end),
  387: 
  388:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  389:     stop_node(Cp1),
  390:     stop_node(Cp2),
  391:     stop_node(Cp3),
  392: 
  393:     init_condition(Config),
  394:     ok.
  395: 
  396: %% OTP-6428. An unregistered name reappears.
  397: lost_unregister(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  398:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
  399:         true ->
  400:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions enabled"};
  401:         false ->
  402:             lost_unregister_test(Config)
  403:     end.
  404: 
  405: lost_unregister_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  406:     Timeout = 30,
  407:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  408:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  409:     init_condition(Config),
  410: 
  411:     {ok, B} = start_node(b, Config),
  412:     {ok, C} = start_node(c, Config),
  413:     Nodes = [node(), B, C],
  414: 
  415:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  416: 
  417:     %% start a proc and register it
  418:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(test),
  419: 
  420:     ?UNTIL(Pid =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  421:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test, Config),
  422: 
  423:     rpc_disconnect_node(B, C, Config),
  424:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test, Config),
  425:     _ = rpc:call(B, global, unregister_name, [test]),
  426:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  427:     Pid = rpc:call(C, global, whereis_name, [test]),
  428:     check_everywhere(Nodes--[C], test, Config),
  429:     pong = rpc:call(B, net_adm, ping, [C]),
  430: 
  431:     %% Now the name has reappeared on node B.
  432:     ?UNTIL(Pid =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  433:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test, Config),
  434: 
  435:     exit_p(Pid),
  436: 
  437:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  438:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test, Config),
  439: 
  440:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  441:     stop_node(B),
  442:     stop_node(C),
  443:     init_condition(Config),
  444:     ok.
  445: 
  446: lost_connection(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  447:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
  448:         true ->
  449:             lost_connection_test(Config);
  450:         false ->
  451:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions disabled"}
  452:     end.
  453: 
  454: lost_connection_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  455:     %% OTP-17843: Registered names could become inconsistent due to
  456:     %%            overlapping partitions. This has been solved by
  457:     %%            global actively disconnecting nodes to prevent
  458:     %%            overlapping partitions.
  459:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 15}),
  460: 
  461:     [Cp1, Cp2] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2], peer, Config),
  462: 
  463:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp1, Cp2]]),
  464: 
  465:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  466: 
  467:     {Gurka, yes} = start_proc_basic(gurka),
  468: 
  469:     check_everywhere([node(), Cp1, Cp2], gurka, Config),
  470: 
  471:     Gurka = global:whereis_name(gurka),
  472: 
  473:     erlang:disconnect_node(Cp2), %% lost connection previously causing issues...
  474: 
  475:     erpc:call(
  476:       PartCtrlr,
  477:       fun () ->
  478:               erpc:call(
  479:                 Cp2,
  480:                 fun () ->
  481:                         {AltGurka, yes} = start_proc_basic(gurka),
  482:                         AltGurka = global:whereis_name(gurka)
  483:                 end),
  484:               timer:sleep(1000),
  485:               erpc:cast(Cp2, erlang, halt, []),
  486:               wait_until(fun () -> not lists:member(Cp2, nodes(hidden)) end)
  487:       end),
  488: 
  489:     Reconnected = case lists:member(Cp1, nodes()) of
  490:                       true ->
  491:                           false;
  492:                       false ->
  493:                           erlang:display("reconnecting Cp1"),
  494:                           pong = net_adm:ping(Cp1),
  495:                           timer:sleep(500),
  496:                           true
  497:                   end,
  498:     
  499:     check_everywhere([node(), Cp1], gurka, Config),
  500: 
  501:     Gurka = global:whereis_name(gurka),
  502: 
  503:     ok = global:unregister_name(gurka),
  504: 
  505:     stop_node(Cp1),
  506:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
  507: 
  508:     {comment, case Reconnected of
  509:                   true -> "Re-connected Cp1";
  510:                   false -> "No re-connection of Cp1 needed"
  511:               end}.
  512: 
  513: lost_connection2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  514:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
  515:         true ->
  516:             lost_connection2_test(Config);
  517:         false ->
  518:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions disabled"}
  519:     end.
  520: 
  521: lost_connection2_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  522:     %% OTP-17843: Registered names could become inconsistent due to
  523:     %%            overlapping partitions. This has been solved by
  524:     %%            global actively disconnecting nodes to prevent
  525:     %%            overlapping partitions.
  526:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 15}),
  527: 
  528:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4], peer, Config),
  529: 
  530:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4]]),
  531: 
  532:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  533: 
  534:     {Gurka, yes} = start_proc_basic(gurka),
  535: 
  536:     check_everywhere([node(), Cp1, Cp2], gurka, Config),
  537: 
  538:     Gurka = global:whereis_name(gurka),
  539: 
  540:     disconnect_nodes(PartCtrlr, Cp3, Cp4),
  541: 
  542:     Nodes = nodes(),
  543:     true = lists:member(Cp1, Nodes),
  544:     true = lists:member(Cp2, Nodes),
  545:     false = lists:member(Cp3, Nodes),
  546:     false = lists:member(Cp4, Nodes),
  547: 
  548:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
  549:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp4),
  550: 
  551:     stop_node(Cp1),
  552:     stop_node(Cp2),
  553:     stop_node(Cp3),
  554:     stop_node(Cp4),
  555:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
  556: 
  557:     ok.
  558: 
  559: -define(UNTIL_LOOP, 300).
  560: 
  561: -define(end_tag, 'end at').
  562: 
  563: init_high_level_trace(Time) ->
  564:     Mul = try 
  565:               test_server:timetrap_scale_factor()
  566: 	  catch _:_ -> 1
  567:           end,
  568:     put(?end_tag, msec() + Time * Mul * 1000),
  569:     %% Assures that started nodes start the high level trace automatically.
  570:     ok = gen_server:call(global_name_server, high_level_trace_start,infinity),
  571:     os:putenv("GLOBAL_HIGH_LEVEL_TRACE", "TRUE"),
  572:     put(?nodes_tag, []).
  573: 
  574: loop_until_true(Fun, Config, N) ->
  575:     %% ?DBG([{n, N}]),
  576:     put(n, N),
  577:     case Fun() of
  578: 	true ->
  579: 	    true;
  580: 	_ ->
  581:             case get(?end_tag) of
  582:                 undefined ->
  583:                     timer:sleep(?UNTIL_LOOP),
  584:                     loop_until_true(Fun, Config, N+1);
  585:                 EndAt ->
  586:                     Left = EndAt - msec(),
  587:                     case Left < 6000 of
  588:                         true -> 
  589:                             write_high_level_trace(Config),
  590:                             Ref = make_ref(),
  591:                             receive Ref -> ok end;
  592:                         false ->
  593:                             timer:sleep(?UNTIL_LOOP),
  594:                             loop_until_true(Fun, Config, N+1)
  595:                     end
  596:             end
  597:     end.
  598: 
  599: write_high_level_trace(Config) ->
  600:     case erase(?nodes_tag) of
  601:         undefined -> 
  602:             ok;
  603:         Nodes0 -> 
  604:             Nodes = lists:usort([node() | Nodes0]),            
  605:             write_high_level_trace(Nodes, Config)
  606:     end.
  607: 
  608: write_high_level_trace(Nodes, Config) ->
  609:     When = erlang:timestamp(),
  610:     %% 'info' returns more than the trace, which is nice.
  611:     Data = [{Node, {info, rpc:call(Node, global, info, [])}} ||
  612:                Node <- Nodes],
  613:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  614:     DataFile = filename:join([Dir, lists:concat(["global_", ?testcase])]),
  615:     io:format("\n\nAnalyze high level trace like this:\n"),
  616:     io:format("global_trace:dd(~p, [{show_state, 0, 10}]). % 10 seconds\n",
  617:              [DataFile]),
  618:     file:write_file(DataFile, term_to_binary({high_level_trace, When, Data})).
  619: 
  620: lock_global2(Id, Parent) ->
  621:     S = global:set_lock(Id),
  622:     Parent ! {locked, S},
  623:     receive
  624: 	{ok, Parent} ->
  625: 	    ok
  626:     end.
  627: 
  628: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  629: %% Test suite for global names and locks.
  630: %% Should be started in a CC view with:
  631: %% erl -sname XXX -rsh ctrsh where XX not in [cp1, cp2, cp3]
  632: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  633: 
  634: %% cp1 - cp3 are started, and the name 'test' registered for a process on
  635: %% test_server. Then it is checked that the name is registered on all
  636: %% nodes, using whereis_name. Check that the same
  637: %% name can't be registered with another value. Exit the registered
  638: %% process and check that the name disappears. Register a new process
  639: %% (Pid2) under the name 'test'. Let another new process (Pid3)
  640: %% reregister itself under the same name. Test global:send/2. Test
  641: %% unregister. Kill Pid3. Start a process (Pid6) on cp3,
  642: %% register it as 'test', stop cp1 - cp3 and check that 'test' disappeared.
  643: %% Kill Pid2 and check that 'test' isn't registered.
  644: 
  645: names(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  646:     ?TC_TRY(names, fun() -> do_names(Config) end).
  647: 
  648: do_names(Config) ->
  649:     ?P("names -> begin when"
  650:        "~n   Nodes: ~p"
  651:        "~n   Names: ~p",
  652:        [nodes(),
  653:         case net_adm:names() of
  654:             {ok, N} ->
  655:                 N;
  656:             _ ->
  657:                 "-"
  658:         end]),
  659:     Timeout = 30,
  660:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  661:     ?P("names -> init high level trace"),
  662:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  663:     ?P("names -> init condition"),
  664:     init_condition(Config),
  665:     ?P("names -> get registered names"),
  666:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
  667: 
  668:     ?P("names -> start node cp1"),
  669:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
  670:     ?P("names -> start node cp2"),
  671:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
  672:     ?P("names -> start node cp3"),
  673:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, Config),
  674: 
  675:     ?P("names -> wait for ready net"),
  676:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  677: 
  678:     %% start a proc and register it
  679:     ?P("names -> start and register process 'test'"),
  680:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(test),
  681: 
  682:     %% test that it is registered at all nodes
  683:     ?P("names -> verify process has been registered on all nodes"),
  684:         ?UNTIL(begin
  685:             (Pid =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  686:             (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  687:             (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  688:             (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  689:             ([test] =:= global:registered_names() -- OrigNames)
  690:            end),
  691:     
  692:     %% try to register the same name
  693:     ?P("names -> try register (locally) another 'test' (and expect rejection)"),
  694:     no = global:register_name(test, self()),
  695:     ?P("names -> try register (on cp1) another 'test' (and expect rejection)"),
  696:     no = rpc:call(Cp1, global, register_name, [test, self()]),
  697:     
  698:     %% let process exit, check that it is unregistered automatically
  699:     ?P("names -> terminate the 'test' process"),
  700:     exit_p(Pid),
  701: 
  702:     ?P("names -> verify 'test' process has been automatically unregistered"),
  703:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  704:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  705:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  706:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  707:     
  708:     %% test re_register
  709:     ?P("names -> start and register another process 'test'"),
  710:     {Pid2, yes} = start_proc(test),
  711:     ?P("names -> verify process 'test' has been registered"),
  712:     ?UNTIL(Pid2 =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test])),
  713:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc2, [test]),
  714:     ?UNTIL(Pid3 =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test])),
  715:     Pid3 = global:whereis_name(test),
  716: 
  717:     %% test sending
  718:     ?P("names -> test sending (from local)"),
  719:     global:send(test, {ping, self()}),
  720:     receive
  721: 	{pong, Cp3} -> ok
  722:     after
  723: 	2000 -> ct:fail(timeout1)
  724:     end,
  725: 
  726:     ?P("names -> test sending (from cp1)"),
  727:     rpc:call(Cp1, global, send, [test, {ping, self()}]),
  728:     receive
  729: 	{pong, Cp3} -> ok
  730:     after
  731: 	2000 -> ct:fail(timeout2)
  732:     end,
  733: 
  734:     ?P("names -> unregister 'test' process"),
  735:     _ = global:unregister_name(test),
  736:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  737:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  738:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  739:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  740: 
  741:     ?P("names -> terminate process 'test'"),
  742:     exit_p(Pid3),
  743: 
  744:     ?P("names -> verify not registered"),
  745:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  746: 
  747:     %% register a proc
  748:     ?P("names -> register a process"),
  749:     {_Pid6, yes} = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, [test]),
  750: 
  751:     ?P("names -> write high level trace"),
  752:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  753: 
  754:     %% stop the nodes, and make sure names are released.
  755:     ?P("names -> stop node cp1"),
  756:     stop_node(Cp1),
  757:     ?P("names -> stop node cp2"),
  758:     stop_node(Cp2),
  759:     ?P("names -> stop node cp3"),
  760:     stop_node(Cp3),
  761: 
  762:     ?P("names -> verify not registered"),
  763:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  764:     exit_p(Pid2),
  765: 
  766:     ?P("names -> verify not registered"),
  767:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  768:     init_condition(Config),
  769: 
  770:     ?P("names -> done"),
  771:     ok.
  772: 
  773: %% Tests that names on a hidden node doesn't interfere with names on
  774: %% visible nodes.
  775: names_hidden(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  776:     Timeout = 30,
  777:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  778:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  779:     init_condition(Config),
  780:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
  781:     OrigNodes = nodes(),
  782: 
  783:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
  784:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
  785:     {ok, Cp3} = start_hidden_node(cp3, Config),
  786:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp3]),
  787:     pong = rpc:call(Cp3, net_adm, ping, [Cp2]),
  788:     pong = rpc:call(Cp3, net_adm, ping, [node()]),
  789: 
  790:     [] = [Cp1, Cp2 | OrigNodes] -- nodes(),
  791: 
  792:     %% start a proc on hidden node and register it
  793:     {HPid, yes} = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, [test]),
  794:     Cp3 = node(HPid),
  795: 
  796:     %% Check that it didn't get registered on visible nodes
  797:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  798:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  799:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  800: 
  801:     %% start a proc on visible node and register it
  802:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(test),
  803:     true = (Pid =/= HPid),
  804: 
  805:     %% test that it is registered at all nodes
  806:         ?UNTIL((Pid =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  807:            (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  808:            (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  809:            (HPid =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  810:            ([test] =:= global:registered_names() -- OrigNames)),
  811:     
  812:     %% try to register the same name
  813:     no = global:register_name(test, self()),
  814:     no = rpc:call(Cp1, global, register_name, [test, self()]),
  815:     
  816:     %% let process exit, check that it is unregistered automatically
  817:     exit_p(Pid),
  818: 
  819:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  820:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  821:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  822:            (HPid      =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  823:     
  824:     %% test re_register
  825:     {Pid2, yes} = start_proc(test),
  826:     ?UNTIL(Pid2 =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])),
  827:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc2, [test]),
  828:     ?UNTIL(Pid3 =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])),
  829:     Pid3 = global:whereis_name(test),
  830: 
  831:     %% test sending
  832:     Pid3 = global:send(test, {ping, self()}),
  833:     receive
  834: 	{pong, Cp2} -> ok
  835:     after
  836: 	2000 -> ct:fail(timeout1)
  837:     end,
  838: 
  839:     rpc:call(Cp1, global, send, [test, {ping, self()}]),
  840:     receive
  841: 	{pong, Cp2} -> ok
  842:     after
  843: 	2000 -> ct:fail(timeout2)
  844:     end,
  845: 
  846:     _ = rpc:call(Cp3, global, unregister_name, [test]),
  847:         ?UNTIL((Pid3      =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  848:            (Pid3      =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  849:            (Pid3      =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  850:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  851: 
  852:     _ = global:unregister_name(test),
  853:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  854:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  855:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  856:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  857: 
  858:     exit_p(Pid3),
  859:     exit_p(HPid),
  860: 
  861:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  862: 
  863:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  864: 
  865:     %% stop the nodes, and make sure names are released.
  866:     stop_node(Cp1),
  867:     stop_node(Cp2),
  868:     stop_node(Cp3),
  869: 
  870:     init_condition(Config),
  871:     ok.
  872: 
  873: locks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  874:     Timeout = 30,
  875:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  876:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  877:     init_condition(Config),
  878:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
  879:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
  880:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, Config),
  881: 
  882:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  883: 
  884:     %% start two procs
  885:     Pid = start_proc(),
  886:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  887: 
  888:     %% set a lock, and make sure no one else can set the same lock
  889:     true = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
  890:     false = req(Pid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  891:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  892: 
  893:     %% delete, and let another proc set the lock
  894:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
  895:     true = req(Pid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  896:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  897:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES,1),
  898: 
  899:     %% kill lock-holding proc, make sure the lock is released
  900:     exit_p(Pid),
  901:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES,1)),
  902:     Pid2 ! {set_lock_loop, test_lock, self()},
  903: 
  904:     %% make sure we don't have the msg
  905:     receive
  906: 	{got_lock, Pid2} -> ct:fail(got_lock)
  907:     after
  908: 	1000 -> ok
  909:     end,
  910:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
  911: 
  912:     %% make sure pid2 got the lock
  913:     receive
  914: 	{got_lock, Pid2} -> ok
  915:     after
  916: 	%% 12000 >> 5000, which is the max time before a new retry for
  917:         %% set_lock
  918: 	12000 -> ct:fail(got_lock2)
  919:     end,
  920: 
  921:     %% let proc set the same lock
  922:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  923: 
  924:     %% let proc set new lock
  925:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock2, self()}),
  926:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()},?NODES,1),
  927:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES,1),
  928:     exit_p(Pid2),
  929:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
  930:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
  931:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
  932:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}),
  933: 
  934:     %% let proc set two locks
  935:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  936:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  937:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock, test_lock2, self()}),
  938: 
  939:     %% del one lock
  940:     Pid3 ! {del_lock, test_lock2},
  941:     ct:sleep(100),
  942: 
  943:     %% check that one lock is still set, but not the other
  944:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
  945:     true = global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
  946:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}),
  947: 
  948:     %% kill lock-holder
  949:     exit_p(Pid3),
  950: 
  951:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
  952:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
  953:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
  954:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}),
  955: 
  956:     %% start one proc on each node
  957:     Pid4 = start_proc(),
  958:     Pid5 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  959:     Pid6 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  960:     Pid7 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  961: 
  962:     %% set lock on two nodes
  963:     true = req(Pid4, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]}),
  964:     false = req(Pid5, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]}),
  965: 
  966:     %% set same lock on other two nodes
  967:     true = req(Pid6, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
  968:     false = req(Pid7, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
  969: 
  970:     %% release lock
  971:     Pid6 ! {del_lock, test_lock, [Cp2, Cp3]},
  972: 
  973:     %% try to set lock on a node that already has the lock
  974:     false = req(Pid6, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]}),
  975: 
  976:     %% set lock on a node
  977:     exit_p(Pid4),
  978:     ?UNTIL(true =:= req(Pid5, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]})),
  979:     Pid8 = start_proc(),
  980:     false = req(Pid8, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  981:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  982: 
  983:     %% stop the nodes, and make sure locks are released.
  984:     stop_node(Cp1),
  985:     stop_node(Cp2),
  986:     stop_node(Cp3),
  987:     ct:sleep(100),
  988:     true = req(Pid8, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  989:     exit_p(Pid8),
  990:     ct:sleep(10),
  991: 
  992:     init_condition(Config),
  993:     ok.
  994: 
  995: 
  996: %% Tests that locks on a hidden node doesn't interere with locks on
  997: %% visible nodes.
  998: locks_hidden(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  999:     Timeout = 30,
 1000:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1001:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1002:     init_condition(Config),
 1003:     OrigNodes = nodes(),
 1004:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
 1005:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
 1006:     {ok, Cp3} = start_hidden_node(cp3, Config),
 1007:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp3]),
 1008:     pong = rpc:call(Cp3, net_adm, ping, [Cp2]),
 1009:     pong = rpc:call(Cp3, net_adm, ping, [node()]),
 1010: 
 1011:     [] = [Cp1, Cp2 | OrigNodes] -- nodes(),
 1012: 
 1013:     %% start two procs
 1014:     Pid = start_proc(),
 1015:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1016:     HPid = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1017: 
 1018:     %% Make sure hidden node doesn't interfere with visible nodes lock
 1019:     true = req(HPid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1020:     true = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
 1021:     false = req(Pid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1022:     true = req(HPid, {del_lock_sync, test_lock, self()}),
 1023:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1024: 
 1025:     %% delete, and let another proc set the lock
 1026:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
 1027:     true = req(Pid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1028:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1029:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES,1),
 1030: 
 1031:     %% kill lock-holding proc, make sure the lock is released
 1032:     exit_p(Pid),
 1033:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
 1034:     ?UNTIL(true =:= req(HPid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()})),
 1035:     Pid2 ! {set_lock_loop, test_lock, self()},
 1036: 
 1037:     %% make sure we don't have the msg
 1038:     receive
 1039: 	{got_lock, Pid2} -> ct:fail(got_lock)
 1040:     after
 1041: 	1000 -> ok
 1042:     end,
 1043:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
 1044: 
 1045:     %% make sure pid2 got the lock
 1046:     receive
 1047: 	{got_lock, Pid2} -> ok
 1048:     after
 1049: 	%% 12000 >> 5000, which is the max time before a new retry for
 1050:         %% set_lock
 1051: 	12000 -> ct:fail(got_lock2)
 1052:     end,
 1053:     true = req(HPid, {del_lock_sync, test_lock, self()}),
 1054: 
 1055:     %% let proc set the same lock
 1056:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1057: 
 1058:     %% let proc set new lock
 1059:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock2, self()}),
 1060:     true = req(HPid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1061:     true = req(HPid, {set_lock, test_lock2, self()}),
 1062:     exit_p(HPid),
 1063:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()},?NODES,1),
 1064:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES,1),
 1065: 
 1066:     exit_p(Pid2),
 1067:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
 1068:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
 1069:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
 1070:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}),
 1071: 
 1072:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1073: 
 1074:     %% stop the nodes, and make sure locks are released.
 1075:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1076:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1077:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1078: 
 1079:     init_condition(Config),
 1080:     ok.
 1081: 
 1082: 
 1083: bad_input(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1084:     Timeout = 15,
 1085:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1086:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1087:     init_condition(Config),
 1088:     Pid = whereis(global_name_server),
 1089:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:set_lock(bad_id)),
 1090:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:set_lock({id, self()}, bad_nodes)),
 1091:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:del_lock(bad_id)),
 1092:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:del_lock({id, self()}, bad_nodes)),
 1093:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:register_name(name, bad_pid)),
 1094:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:reregister_name(name, bad_pid)),
 1095:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:trans(bad_id, {m,f})),
 1096:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:trans({id, self()}, {m,f}, [node()], -1)),
 1097:     Pid = whereis(global_name_server),
 1098:     init_condition(Config),
 1099:     ok.
 1100: 
 1101: names_and_locks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1102:     Timeout = 30,
 1103:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1104:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1105:     init_condition(Config),
 1106:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1107: 
 1108:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
 1109:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
 1110:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, Config),
 1111: 
 1112:     %% start one proc on each node
 1113:     PidTS = start_proc(),
 1114:     Pid1 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1115:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1116:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1117: 
 1118:     %% register some of them
 1119:     yes = global:register_name(test1, Pid1),
 1120:     yes = global:register_name(test2, Pid2),
 1121:     yes = global:register_name(test3, Pid3),
 1122:     no = global:register_name(test3, PidTS),
 1123:     yes = global:register_name(test4, PidTS),
 1124: 
 1125:     %% set lock on two nodes
 1126:     true = req(PidTS, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]}),
 1127:     false = req(Pid1, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]}),
 1128: 
 1129:     %% set same lock on other two nodes
 1130:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1131:     false = req(Pid3, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1132: 
 1133:     %% release lock
 1134:     Pid2 ! {del_lock, test_lock, [Cp2, Cp3]},
 1135:     ct:sleep(100),
 1136: 
 1137:     %% try to set lock on a node that already has the lock
 1138:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1139: 
 1140:     %% set two locks
 1141:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1142:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock2, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1143: 
 1144:     %% kill some processes, make sure all locks/names are released
 1145:     exit_p(PidTS),
 1146:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test4)),
 1147:     true = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, [node(), Cp1], 1),
 1148:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}, [node(), Cp1]),
 1149:     
 1150:     exit_p(Pid2),
 1151:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test2)) and
 1152:            (true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, [Cp2, Cp3], 1)) and
 1153:            (true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, [Cp2, Cp3], 1))),
 1154: 
 1155:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}, [Cp2, Cp3]),
 1156:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}, [Cp2, Cp3]),
 1157: 
 1158:     exit_p(Pid1),
 1159:     exit_p(Pid3),
 1160: 
 1161:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1162: 
 1163:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1164:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1165:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1166:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1167: 
 1168:     init_condition(Config),
 1169:     ok.
 1170: 
 1171: %% OTP-6341. Remove locks using monitors.
 1172: lock_die(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1173:     Timeout = 30,
 1174:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1175:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1176:     init_condition(Config),
 1177:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1178: 
 1179:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
 1180:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
 1181: 
 1182:     %% First test.
 1183:     LockId = {id, self()},
 1184:     Pid2 = start_proc(),
 1185:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock2, LockId, self()}),
 1186: 
 1187:     true = global:set_lock(LockId, [Cp1]),
 1188:     %% Id is locked on Cp1 and Cp2 (by Pid2) but not by self(): 
 1189:     %% (there is no mon. ref)
 1190:     _ = global:del_lock(LockId, [node(), Cp1, Cp2]),
 1191: 
 1192:     exit_p(Pid2),
 1193: 
 1194:     %% Second test.
 1195:     Pid3 = start_proc(),
 1196:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock, id, self(), [Cp1]}),
 1197:     %% The lock is removed from Cp1 thanks to monitors.
 1198:     exit_p(Pid3),
 1199: 
 1200:     true = global:set_lock(LockId, [node(), Cp1]),
 1201:     _ = global:del_lock(LockId, [node(), Cp1]),
 1202: 
 1203:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1204:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1205:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1206:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1207:     init_condition(Config),
 1208:     ok.
 1209: 
 1210: %% OTP-6341. Remove names using monitors.
 1211: name_die(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1212:     Timeout = 30,
 1213:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1214:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1215:     init_condition(Config),
 1216:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1217:     [Cp1] = Cps = start_nodes([z], peer,  Config), % z > test_server
 1218:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 1219:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1220: 
 1221:     Name = name_die,
 1222:     Pid = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1223: 
 1224:     %% Test 1. No resolver is called if the same pid is registered on
 1225:     %% both partitions.
 1226:     T1 = node(),
 1227:     Part1 = [T1],
 1228:     Part2 = [Cp1],
 1229: 
 1230:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [Part1, Part2]),
 1231: 
 1232:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(Name)),
 1233:     yes = global:register_name(Name, Pid),
 1234: 
 1235:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp1),
 1236:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1237:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(Name)),
 1238:     exit_p(Pid),
 1239:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1240: 
 1241:     %% Test 2. Register a name running outside the current partition.
 1242:     %% Killing the pid will not remove the name from the current
 1243:     %% partition, unless monitors are used.
 1244:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1245:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1246:     KillFile = filename:join([Dir, "kill.txt"]),
 1247:     file:delete(KillFile),
 1248:     erlang:spawn(Cp1, fun() -> kill_pid(Pid2, KillFile, Config) end),
 1249: 
 1250:     setup_partitions(PartCtrlr, [Part1, Part2]),
 1251: 
 1252:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(Name)),
 1253:     yes = global:register_name(Name, Pid2),
 1254:     touch(KillFile, "kill"),
 1255:     file_contents(KillFile, "done", Config),
 1256:     file:delete(KillFile),
 1257: 
 1258:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1259:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1260:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 1261:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1262:     init_condition(Config),
 1263:     ok.
 1264: 
 1265: kill_pid(Pid, File, Config) ->
 1266:     file_contents(File, "kill", Config),
 1267:     exit_p(Pid),
 1268:     touch(File, "done").
 1269: 
 1270: %% Tests that two partitioned networks exchange correct info.
 1271: basic_partition(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1272:     Timeout = 30,
 1273:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1274:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1275:     init_condition(Config),
 1276:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1277: 
 1278:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2, cp3], peer, Config),
 1279:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = lists:sort(nodes()),
 1280: 
 1281:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1282: 
 1283:     %% make cp2 and cp3 connected, partitioned from us and cp1
 1284:     PCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp1], [Cp2, Cp3]]),
 1285: 
 1286:     %% start different processes in both partitions
 1287:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(test),
 1288: 
 1289:     %% Reach into the other partition via PCtrlr...
 1290:     ok = erpc:call(
 1291:            PCtrlr,
 1292:            fun () ->
 1293:                    {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE,
 1294:                                         start_proc, [test2]),
 1295:                    {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE,
 1296:                                         start_proc, [test4]),
 1297:                    ok
 1298:            end),
 1299: 
 1300:     %% connect to other partition
 1301:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp2),
 1302:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
 1303:     wait_until(fun () -> [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] == lists:sort(nodes()) end),
 1304: 
 1305:     %% check names
 1306:     ?UNTIL(Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])),
 1307:     ?UNTIL(undefined =/= global:whereis_name(test2)),
 1308:     Pid2 = global:whereis_name(test2),
 1309:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test2]),
 1310:     assert_pid(Pid2),
 1311:     Pid3 = global:whereis_name(test4),
 1312:     ?UNTIL(Pid3 =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test4])),
 1313:     assert_pid(Pid3),
 1314: 
 1315:     %% kill all procs
 1316:     Pid3 = global:send(test4, die),
 1317:     %% sleep to let the proc die
 1318:     wait_for_exit(Pid3),
 1319:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test4)),
 1320: 
 1321:     exit_p(Pid),
 1322:     exit_p(Pid2),
 1323: 
 1324:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1325: 
 1326:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1327:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1328:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1329:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1330:     stop_node(PCtrlr),
 1331:     init_condition(Config),
 1332:     ok.
 1333: 
 1334: %% Creates two partitions with two nodes in each partition.
 1335: %% Tests that names are exchanged correctly, and that EXITs
 1336: %% during connect phase are handled correctly.
 1337: basic_name_partition(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1338:     Timeout = 60,
 1339:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1340:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1341:     init_condition(Config),
 1342:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1343: 
 1344:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2, cp3], peer, Config),
 1345:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = lists:sort(nodes()),
 1346:     Nodes = ?NODES,
 1347: 
 1348:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1349: 
 1350:     %% There used to be more than one name registered for some
 1351:     %% processes. That was a mistake; there is no support for more than
 1352:     %% one name per process, and the manual is quite clear about that
 1353:     %% ("equivalent to the register/2 and whereis/1 BIFs"). The
 1354:     %% resolver procedure did not take care of such "duplicated" names,
 1355:     %% which caused this testcase to fail every now and then.
 1356: 
 1357:     %% make cp2 and cp3 connected, partitioned from us and cp1
 1358:     %% us:  register name03
 1359:     %% cp1: register name12
 1360:     %% cp2: register name12
 1361:     %% cp3: register name03
 1362: 
 1363:     PCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp1], [Cp2, Cp3]]),
 1364: 
 1365:     %% start different processes in both partitions
 1366:     {_, yes} = start_proc_basic(name03),
 1367:     {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc_basic, [name12]),
 1368: 
 1369:     %% Reach into the other partition via PCtrlr...
 1370:     ok = erpc:call(
 1371:            PCtrlr,
 1372:            fun () ->
 1373:                    {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE,
 1374:                                         start_proc_basic, [name12]),
 1375:                    {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE,
 1376:                                         start_proc_basic, [name03]),
 1377:                    ok
 1378:            end),
 1379: 
 1380:     ct:sleep(1000),
 1381: 
 1382:     %% connect to other partition
 1383:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
 1384: 
 1385:     ?UNTIL([Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] =:= lists:sort(nodes())),
 1386:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1387: 
 1388:     %% check names
 1389:     Pid03 = global:whereis_name(name03),
 1390:     assert_pid(Pid03),
 1391:     true = lists:member(node(Pid03), [node(), Cp3]),
 1392:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name03, Config),
 1393: 
 1394:     Pid12 = global:whereis_name(name12),
 1395:     assert_pid(Pid12),
 1396:     true = lists:member(node(Pid12), [Cp1, Cp2]),
 1397:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name12, Config),
 1398: 
 1399:     %% kill all procs
 1400:     Pid12 = global:send(name12, die),
 1401:     Pid03 = global:send(name03, die),
 1402: 
 1403:     %% sleep to let the procs die
 1404:     wait_for_exit(Pid12),
 1405:     wait_for_exit(Pid03),
 1406:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1407: 	       Names = [name03, name12],
 1408: 	       lists:duplicate(length(Names), undefined)
 1409: 		   =:= [global:whereis_name(Name) || Name <- Names]
 1410: 	   end),
 1411: 
 1412:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1413: 
 1414:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1415:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1416:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1417:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1418:     stop_node(PCtrlr),
 1419:     init_condition(Config),
 1420:     ok.
 1421: 
 1422: %% Peer nodes cp0 - cp6 are started. Break apart the connections from
 1423: %% cp3-cp6 to cp0-cp2 and test_server so we get two partitions.
 1424: %% In the cp3-cp6 partition, start one process on each node and register
 1425: %% using both erlang:register, and global:register (test1 on cp3, test2 on
 1426: %% cp4, test3 on cp5, test4 on cp6), using different resolution functions:
 1427: %% default for test1, notify_all_name for test2, random_notify_name for test3
 1428: %% and one for test4 that sends a message to test_server and keeps the
 1429: %% process which is greater in the standard ordering. In the other partition,
 1430: %% do the same (test1 on test_server, test2 on cp0, test3 on cp1, test4 on cp2).
 1431: %% Sleep a little, then from test_server, connect to cp3-cp6 in order.
 1432: %% Check that the values for the registered names are the expected ones, and
 1433: %% that the messages from test4 arrive.
 1434: 
 1435: %% Test that names are resolved correctly when two
 1436: %% partitioned networks connect.
 1437: advanced_partition(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1438:     Timeout = 60,
 1439:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1440:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1441:     init_condition(Config),
 1442:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1443: 
 1444:     Parent = self(),
 1445: 
 1446:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6]
 1447: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5, cp6], peer, Config),
 1448:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6]),
 1449:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1450: 
 1451:     %% make cp3-cp6 connected, partitioned from us and cp0-cp2
 1452:     PCntrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2], [Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6]]),
 1453: 
 1454:     %% start processes in other partition (via partition controller)...
 1455:     _ = erpc:call(PCntrlr,
 1456:                   fun () ->
 1457:                           erpc:call(Cp3,
 1458:                                     fun () ->
 1459:                                             start_procs(Parent, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Config)
 1460:                                     end)
 1461:                   end),
 1462: 
 1463:     %% start different processes in this partition
 1464:     start_procs(self(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Config),
 1465: 
 1466:     %% connect to other partition
 1467:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
 1468: 
 1469:     wait_until(fun () ->
 1470:                        CurrNodes = lists:sort(?NODES),
 1471:                        io:format("CurrNodes: ~p~n", [CurrNodes]),
 1472:                        Nodes == CurrNodes end),
 1473: 
 1474:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1475: 
 1476:     ?UNTIL(lists:member(undefined,
 1477: 			[rpc:call(Cp3, erlang, whereis, [test1]),
 1478: 			 rpc:call(node(), erlang, whereis, [test1])])),
 1479: 
 1480:     Nt1 = rpc:call(Cp3, erlang, whereis, [test1]),
 1481:     Nt2 = rpc:call(Cp4, erlang, whereis, [test2]),
 1482:     Nt3 = rpc:call(Cp5, erlang, whereis, [test3]),
 1483:     Nt4 = rpc:call(Cp6, erlang, whereis, [test4]),
 1484: 
 1485:     Mt1 = rpc:call(node(), erlang, whereis, [test1]),
 1486:     Mt2 = rpc:call(Cp0, erlang, whereis, [test2]),
 1487:     Mt3 = rpc:call(Cp1, erlang, whereis, [test3]),
 1488:     _Mt4 = rpc:call(Cp2, erlang, whereis, [test4]),
 1489: 
 1490:     %% check names
 1491:     Pid1 = global:whereis_name(test1),
 1492:     Pid1 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test1]),
 1493:     assert_pid(Pid1),
 1494:     true = lists:member(Pid1, [Nt1, Mt1]),
 1495:     true = lists:member(undefined, [Nt1, Mt1]),
 1496:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test1, Config),
 1497: 
 1498:     undefined = global:whereis_name(test2),
 1499:     undefined = rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test2]),
 1500:     yes = sreq(Nt2, {got_notify, self()}),
 1501:     yes = sreq(Mt2, {got_notify, self()}),
 1502:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test2, Config),
 1503: 
 1504:     Pid3 = global:whereis_name(test3),
 1505:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test3]),
 1506:     assert_pid(Pid3),
 1507:     true = lists:member(Pid3, [Nt3, Mt3]),
 1508:     no = sreq(Pid3, {got_notify, self()}),
 1509:     yes = sreq(other(Pid3, [Nt2, Nt3]), {got_notify, self()}),
 1510:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test3, Config),
 1511: 
 1512:     Pid4 = global:whereis_name(test4),
 1513:     Pid4 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test4]),
 1514:     assert_pid(Pid4),
 1515:     Pid4 = Nt4,
 1516:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test4, Config),
 1517: 
 1518:     1 = collect_resolves(),
 1519: 
 1520:     Pid1 = global:send(test1, die),
 1521:     exit_p(Pid3),
 1522:     exit_p(Pid4),
 1523:     wait_for_exit(Pid1),
 1524:     wait_for_exit(Pid3),
 1525:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1526: 
 1527:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1528:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1529:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1530:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1531:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1532:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1533:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1534:     stop_node(Cp6),
 1535:     stop_node(PCntrlr),
 1536:     init_condition(Config),
 1537:     ok.
 1538: 
 1539: %% Peer nodes cp0 - cp6 are started, and partitioned just like in
 1540: %% advanced_partition. Start cp8, only connected to test_server. Let cp6
 1541: %% break apart from the rest, and 12 s later, ping cp0 and cp3, and
 1542: %% register the name test5. After the same 12 s, let cp5 halt.
 1543: %% Wait for the death of cp5. Ping cp3 (at the same time as cp6 does).
 1544: %% Take down cp2. Start cp7, restart cp2. Ping cp4, cp6 and cp8.
 1545: %% Now, expect all nodes to be connected and have the same picture of all
 1546: %% registered names.
 1547: 
 1548: %% Stress global, make a partitioned net, make some nodes
 1549: %% go up/down a bit.
 1550: stress_partition(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1551:     Timeout = 90,
 1552:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1553:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1554:     init_condition(Config),
 1555:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1556: 
 1557:     Parent = self(),
 1558: 
 1559:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6a, Cp6b]
 1560: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5, cp6a, cp6b], peer, Config),
 1561: 
 1562:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1563: 
 1564:     %% make cp3-cp5 connected, partitioned from us and cp0-cp2
 1565:     %% cp6 is alone (single node).  cp6 pings cp0 and cp3 in 12 secs...
 1566:     PCntrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2], [Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6a], [Cp6b]]),
 1567: 
 1568:     %% start processes in other partition (via partition controller)...
 1569:     _ = erpc:call(PCntrlr,
 1570:                   fun () ->
 1571:                           erpc:call(Cp3,
 1572:                                     fun () ->
 1573:                                             start_procs(Parent, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6a, Config)
 1574:                                     end),
 1575:                           erpc:call(Cp6b,
 1576:                                     fun () ->
 1577:                                             Pid1 = start_proc3(test1),
 1578:                                             assert_pid(Pid1),
 1579:                                             Pid2 = start_proc3(test3),
 1580:                                             assert_pid(Pid2),
 1581:                                             yes = global:register_name(
 1582:                                                     test1, Pid1),
 1583:                                             yes = global:register_name(
 1584:                                                     test3, Pid2,
 1585:                                                     fun global:random_notify_name/3)
 1586:                                     end),
 1587:                           %% Make Cp5 crash
 1588:                           erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, crash, [12000]),
 1589:                           %% Make Cp6b alone
 1590:                           erpc:cast(Cp6b, ?MODULE, alone, [Cp0, Cp3])
 1591:                   end),
 1592: 
 1593:     erlang:display(starting_test),
 1594:     %% start different processes in this partition
 1595:     start_procs(self(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Config),
 1596: 
 1597:     {ok, Cp8} = start_peer_node(cp8, Config),
 1598: 
 1599:     monitor_node(Cp5, true),
 1600:     receive
 1601: 	{nodedown, Cp5} -> ok
 1602:     after
 1603: 	20000 -> ct:fail({no_nodedown, Cp5})
 1604:     end,
 1605:     monitor_node(Cp5, false),    
 1606: 
 1607:     %% Ok, now cp6 pings us, and cp5 will go down.
 1608: 
 1609:     %% connect to other partition
 1610:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
 1611:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp4),
 1612:     rpc_cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, crash, [0]),
 1613: 
 1614:     %% Start new nodes
 1615:     {ok, Cp7} = start_peer_node(cp7, Config),
 1616:     {ok, Cp2_2} = start_peer_node(cp2, Config),
 1617:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2_2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp6a, Cp6b, Cp7, Cp8]),
 1618:     put(?nodes_tag, Nodes),
 1619: 
 1620:     %% We don't know how the crashes partitions the net, so
 1621:     %% we cast trough all nodes so we get them all connected
 1622:     %% again...
 1623:     cast_line(Nodes),
 1624: 
 1625:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1626: 
 1627:     %% Make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1628:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test1, Config),
 1629:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(test1)),
 1630: 
 1631:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test2, Config),
 1632:     undefined = global:whereis_name(test2),
 1633: 
 1634:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test3, Config),
 1635:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(test3)),
 1636: 
 1637:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test4, Config),
 1638:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(test4)),
 1639: 
 1640:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test5, Config),
 1641:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test5)),
 1642: 
 1643:     assert_pid(global:send(test1, die)),
 1644:     assert_pid(global:send(test3, die)),
 1645:     assert_pid(global:send(test4, die)),
 1646: 
 1647:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1648: 
 1649:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1650:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1651:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1652:     stop_node(Cp2_2),
 1653:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1654:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1655:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1656:     stop_node(Cp6a),
 1657:     stop_node(Cp6b),
 1658:     stop_node(Cp7),
 1659:     stop_node(Cp8),
 1660:     stop_node(PCntrlr),
 1661:     init_condition(Config),
 1662:     ok.
 1663: 
 1664: 
 1665: %% Use this one to test a lot of connection tests
 1666: %%  erl -sname ts -ring_line 10000 -s test_server run_test global_SUITE
 1667: 
 1668: ring_line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1669:     {ok, [[N]]} = init:get_argument(ring_line),
 1670:     loop_it(list_to_integer(N), Config).
 1671: 
 1672: loop_it(N, Config) -> loop_it(N,N, Config).
 1673: 
 1674: loop_it(0,_, _Config) -> ok;
 1675: loop_it(N,M, Config) ->
 1676:     ct:pal(?HI_VERBOSITY, "Round: ~w", [M-N]),
 1677:     ring(Config),
 1678:     line(Config),
 1679:     loop_it(N-1,M, Config).
 1680: 
 1681: 
 1682: %% Make 10 single nodes, all having the same name.
 1683: %% Make all ping its predecessor, pinging in a ring.
 1684: %% Make sure that there's just one winner.
 1685: ring(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1686:     Timeout = 60,
 1687:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1688:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1689:     init_condition(Config),
 1690:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1691: 
 1692:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Cp7, Cp8]
 1693: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5, cp6, cp7, cp8], 
 1694:                       peer, Config),
 1695:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Cp7, Cp8]),
 1696: 
 1697:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1698: 
 1699:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config,
 1700:                                  [[node()], [Cp0], [Cp1], [Cp2], [Cp3],
 1701:                                   [Cp4], [Cp5], [Cp6], [Cp7], [Cp8]]),
 1702: 
 1703:     Time = msec() + 1000,
 1704: 
 1705:     ok = erpc:call(
 1706:            PartCtrlr,
 1707:            fun () ->
 1708:                    erpc:cast(Cp0, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp8]), % ping ourself!
 1709:                    erpc:cast(Cp1, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]),
 1710:                    erpc:cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp1]),
 1711:                    erpc:cast(Cp3, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp2]),
 1712:                    erpc:cast(Cp4, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp3]),
 1713:                    erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp4]),
 1714:                    erpc:cast(Cp6, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp5]),
 1715:                    erpc:cast(Cp7, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp6]),
 1716:                    erpc:cast(Cp8, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp7]),
 1717:                    ok
 1718:            end),
 1719: 
 1720:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp0),
 1721: 
 1722:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1723: 
 1724:     %% Just make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1725:     check_everywhere(Nodes, single_name, Config),
 1726:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(single_name)),
 1727: 
 1728:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1729:                {Ns2, []} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, erlang, whereis, 
 1730:                                          [single_name]),
 1731:                9 =:= lists:foldl(fun(undefined, N) -> N + 1;
 1732:                                     (_, N) -> N
 1733:                                  end,
 1734:                                  0, Ns2)
 1735:            end),
 1736: 
 1737:     assert_pid(global:send(single_name, die)),
 1738: 
 1739:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1740: 
 1741:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1742:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1743:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1744:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1745:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1746:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1747:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1748:     stop_node(Cp6),
 1749:     stop_node(Cp7),
 1750:     stop_node(Cp8),
 1751:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1752:     init_condition(Config),
 1753:     ok.
 1754: 
 1755: %% Simpler version of the ring case.  Used because there are some
 1756: %% distribution problems with many nodes.
 1757: %% Make 6 single nodes, all having the same name.
 1758: %% Make all ping its predecessor, pinging in a ring.
 1759: %% Make sure that there's just one winner.
 1760: simple_ring(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1761:     Timeout = 60,
 1762:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1763:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1764:     init_condition(Config),
 1765:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1766: 
 1767:     Names = [cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5],
 1768:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5]
 1769: 	= start_nodes(Names, peer, Config),
 1770:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5]),
 1771: 
 1772:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1773: 
 1774:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config,
 1775:                                  [[node()], [Cp0], [Cp1], [Cp2], [Cp3],
 1776:                                   [Cp4], [Cp5]]),
 1777:     Time = msec() + 1000,
 1778: 
 1779:     ok = erpc:call(
 1780:            PartCtrlr,
 1781:            fun () ->
 1782:                    erpc:cast(Cp0, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp5]), % ping ourself!
 1783:                    erpc:cast(Cp1, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]),
 1784:                    erpc:cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp1]),
 1785:                    erpc:cast(Cp3, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp2]),
 1786:                    erpc:cast(Cp4, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp3]),
 1787:                    erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp4]),
 1788:                    ok
 1789:            end),
 1790: 
 1791:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp0),
 1792: 
 1793:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1794: 
 1795:     %% Just make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1796:     check_everywhere(Nodes, single_name, Config),
 1797:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(single_name)),
 1798: 
 1799:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1800:                {Ns2, []} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, erlang, whereis, 
 1801:                                          [single_name]),
 1802:                6 =:= lists:foldl(fun(undefined, N) -> N + 1;
 1803:                                     (_, N) -> N
 1804:                                  end,
 1805:                                  0, Ns2)
 1806:            end),
 1807: 
 1808:     assert_pid(global:send(single_name, die)),
 1809: 
 1810:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1811: 
 1812:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1813:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1814:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1815:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1816:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1817:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1818:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1819:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1820:     init_condition(Config),
 1821:     ok.
 1822: 
 1823: %% Make 6 single nodes, all having the same name.
 1824: %% Make all ping its predecessor, pinging in a line.
 1825: %% Make sure that there's just one winner.
 1826: line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1827:     Timeout = 60,
 1828:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1829:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1830:     init_condition(Config),
 1831:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1832: 
 1833:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Cp7, Cp8]
 1834: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5, cp6, cp7, cp8], 
 1835:                       peer, Config),
 1836:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Cp7, Cp8]),
 1837: 
 1838:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1839: 
 1840:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config,
 1841:                                  [[node()], [Cp0], [Cp1], [Cp2], [Cp3],
 1842:                                   [Cp4], [Cp5], [Cp6], [Cp7], [Cp8]]),
 1843:     ThisNode = node(),
 1844: 
 1845:     Time = msec() + 1000,
 1846:     ok = erpc:call(
 1847:            PartCtrlr,
 1848:            fun () ->
 1849:                    erpc:cast(Cp0, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]), % ping ourself!
 1850:                    erpc:cast(Cp1, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]),
 1851:                    erpc:cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp1]),
 1852:                    erpc:cast(Cp3, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp2]),
 1853:                    erpc:cast(Cp4, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp3]),
 1854:                    erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp4]),
 1855:                    erpc:cast(Cp6, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp5]),
 1856:                    erpc:cast(Cp7, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp6]),
 1857:                    erpc:cast(Cp8, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp7]),
 1858:                    erpc:cast(ThisNode, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp8]),
 1859:                    ok
 1860:            end),
 1861: 
 1862:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1863: 
 1864:     %% Just make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1865:     check_everywhere(Nodes, single_name, Config),
 1866:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(single_name)),
 1867: 
 1868:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1869: 	       {Ns2, []} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, erlang, whereis,
 1870: 					 [single_name]),
 1871:  	       9 =:= lists:foldl(fun(undefined, N) -> N + 1;
 1872:                                     (_, N) -> N
 1873:                                  end,
 1874:                                  0, Ns2)
 1875: 	   end),
 1876: 
 1877:     assert_pid(global:send(single_name, die)),
 1878: 
 1879:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1880: 
 1881:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1882:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1883:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1884:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1885:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1886:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1887:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1888:     stop_node(Cp6),
 1889:     stop_node(Cp7),
 1890:     stop_node(Cp8),
 1891:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1892:     init_condition(Config),
 1893:     ok.
 1894: 
 1895: 
 1896: %% Simpler version of the line case.  Used because there are some
 1897: %% distribution problems with many nodes.
 1898: %% Make 6 single nodes, all having the same name.
 1899: %% Make all ping its predecessor, pinging in a line.
 1900: %% Make sure that there's just one winner.
 1901: simple_line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1902:     Timeout = 60,
 1903:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1904:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1905:     init_condition(Config),
 1906:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1907: 
 1908:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5]
 1909: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5], peer, Config),
 1910:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5]),
 1911: 
 1912:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1913: 
 1914:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config,
 1915:                                  [[node()], [Cp0], [Cp1], [Cp2], [Cp3],
 1916:                                   [Cp4], [Cp5]]),
 1917:     ThisNode = node(),
 1918: 
 1919:     Time = msec() + 1000,
 1920:     ok = erpc:call(
 1921:            PartCtrlr,
 1922:            fun () ->
 1923:                    erpc:cast(Cp0, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]), % ping ourself!
 1924:                    erpc:cast(Cp1, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]),
 1925:                    erpc:cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp1]),
 1926:                    erpc:cast(Cp3, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp2]),
 1927:                    erpc:cast(Cp4, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp3]),
 1928:                    erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp4]),
 1929:                    erpc:cast(ThisNode, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp5]),
 1930:                    ok
 1931:            end),
 1932: 
 1933:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1934: 
 1935:     %% Just make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1936:     check_everywhere(Nodes, single_name, Config),
 1937:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(single_name)),
 1938: 
 1939:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1940: 	       {Ns2, []} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, erlang, whereis,
 1941: 					 [single_name]),
 1942:  	       6 =:= lists:foldl(fun(undefined, N) -> N + 1;
 1943:                                     (_, N) -> N
 1944:                                  end,
 1945:                                  0, Ns2)
 1946: 	   end),
 1947: 
 1948:     assert_pid(global:send(single_name, die)),
 1949: 
 1950:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1951: 
 1952:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1953:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1954:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1955:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1956:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1957:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1958:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1959:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1960:     init_condition(Config),
 1961:     ok.
 1962: 
 1963: %% Test ticket: Global should keep track of all pids that set the same lock.
 1964: otp_1849(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1965:     Timeout = 30,
 1966:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1967:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1968:     init_condition(Config),
 1969:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
 1970:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
 1971:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, Config),
 1972: 
 1973:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1974: 
 1975:     %% start procs on each node
 1976:     Pid1 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1977:     assert_pid(Pid1),
 1978:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1979:     assert_pid(Pid2),
 1980:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1981:     assert_pid(Pid3),
 1982: 
 1983:     %% set a lock on every node
 1984:     true = req(Pid1, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 1985:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 1986:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 1987: 
 1988:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1989:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock1}] = 
 1990:                    rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 1991:                3 =:= length(Lock1)
 1992:            end),
 1993: 
 1994:     true = req(Pid3, {del_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 1995:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1996:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock2}] = 
 1997:                    rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 1998:                2 =:= length(Lock2)
 1999:            end),
 2000: 
 2001:     true = req(Pid2, {del_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2002:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2003:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock3}] = 
 2004:                    rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2005:                1 =:= length(Lock3)
 2006:            end),
 2007: 
 2008:     true = req(Pid1, {del_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2009:     ?UNTIL([] =:= rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks])),
 2010: 
 2011: 
 2012:     true = req(Pid1, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2013:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2014:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2015:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock2, {test_lock, not_valid}, self()}),
 2016:
