 2017:     exit_p(Pid1),
 2018:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2019:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock10}] = 
 2020:                    rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2021:                2 =:= length(Lock10)
 2022:            end),
 2023:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2024:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock11}] = 
 2025:                    rpc:call(Cp2, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2026:                2 =:= length(Lock11)
 2027:            end),
 2028:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2029:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock12}] = 
 2030:                    rpc:call(Cp3, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2031:                2 =:= length(Lock12)
 2032:            end),
 2033: 
 2034:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2035:     stop_node(Cp1),
 2036:     stop_node(Cp2),
 2037:     stop_node(Cp3),
 2038:     init_condition(Config),
 2039:     ok.
 2040: 
 2041: 
 2042: %% Test ticket: Deadlock in global.
 2043: otp_3162(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2044:     StartFun = fun() ->
 2045:                        {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, peer, Config),
 2046:                        {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, peer, Config),
 2047:                        {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, peer, Config),
 2048:                        [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]
 2049:                end,
 2050:     do_otp_3162(StartFun, Config).
 2051: 
 2052: do_otp_3162(StartFun, Config) ->
 2053:     Timeout = 30,
 2054:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2055:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2056:     init_condition(Config),
 2057:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = StartFun(),
 2058: 
 2059:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2060: 
 2061:     ThisNode = node(),
 2062: 
 2063:     PartCntrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[ThisNode, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]]),
 2064: 
 2065:     %% start procs on each node
 2066:     Pid1 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc4, [kalle]),
 2067:     assert_pid(Pid1),
 2068:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc4, [stina]),
 2069:     assert_pid(Pid2),
 2070:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc4, [vera]),
 2071:     assert_pid(Pid3),
 2072: 
 2073:     disconnect_nodes(PartCntrlr, Cp1, Cp2),
 2074:     %% Nowadays we do not know how the net have been partitioned after the
 2075:     %% disconnect, so we cannot perform all the tests this testcase originally
 2076:     %% did. We instead only test the end result is ok after we have reconnected
 2077:     %% all nodes.
 2078: 
 2079:     erpc:call(PartCntrlr,
 2080:               fun () ->
 2081:                       erpc:cast(Cp1, net_kernel, connect_node, [Cp3]),
 2082:                       erpc:cast(Cp2, net_kernel, connect_node, [Cp3]),
 2083:                       erpc:cast(ThisNode, net_kernel, connect_node, [Cp3])
 2084:               end),
 2085: 
 2086:     ?UNTIL(lists:sort([ThisNode, Cp1, Cp2]) =:=
 2087:                lists:sort(erpc:call(Cp3, erlang, nodes, []))),
 2088:     ?UNTIL([kalle, stina, vera] =:=
 2089: 	       lists:sort(erpc:call(Cp3, global, registered_names, []))),
 2090: 
 2091:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2092:     stop_node(Cp1),
 2093:     stop_node(Cp2),
 2094:     stop_node(Cp3),
 2095:     stop_partition_controller(PartCntrlr),
 2096:     init_condition(Config),
 2097:     ok.
 2098: 
 2099: 
 2100: %% OTP-5640. 'allow' multiple names for registered processes.
 2101: otp_5640(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2102:     Timeout = 25,
 2103:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2104:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2105:     init_condition(Config),
 2106:     {ok, B} = start_node(b, Config),
 2107: 
 2108:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), B]),
 2109:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 2110: 
 2111:     Server = whereis(global_name_server),
 2112:     ServerB = rpc:call(B, erlang, whereis, [global_name_server]),
 2113: 
 2114:     Me = self(),
 2115:     Proc = spawn(fun() -> otp_5640_proc(Me) end),
 2116: 
 2117:     yes = global:register_name(name1, Proc),
 2118:     no = global:register_name(name2, Proc),
 2119: 
 2120:     ok = application:set_env(kernel, global_multi_name_action, allow),
 2121:     yes = global:register_name(name2, Proc),
 2122: 
 2123:     ct:sleep(100),
 2124:     Proc = global:whereis_name(name1),
 2125:     Proc = global:whereis_name(name2),
 2126:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name1, Config),
 2127:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name2, Config),
 2128: 
 2129:     {monitors_2levels, MonBy1} = mon_by_servers(Proc),
 2130:     [] = ([Server,Server,ServerB,ServerB] -- MonBy1),
 2131:     {links,[]} = process_info(Proc, links),
 2132:     _ = global:unregister_name(name1),
 2133: 
 2134:     ct:sleep(100),
 2135:     undefined = global:whereis_name(name1),
 2136:     Proc = global:whereis_name(name2),
 2137:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name1, Config),
 2138:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name2, Config),
 2139: 
 2140:     {monitors_2levels, MonBy2} = mon_by_servers(Proc),
 2141:     [] = ([Server,ServerB] -- MonBy2),
 2142:     TmpMonBy2 = MonBy2 -- [Server,ServerB],
 2143:     TmpMonBy2 = TmpMonBy2 -- [Server,ServerB],
 2144:     {links,[]} = process_info(Proc, links),
 2145: 
 2146:     yes = global:register_name(name1, Proc),
 2147: 
 2148:     Proc ! die,
 2149: 
 2150:     ct:sleep(100),
 2151:     undefined = global:whereis_name(name1),
 2152:     undefined = global:whereis_name(name2),
 2153:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name1, Config),
 2154:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name2, Config),
 2155:     {monitors, GMonitors} = process_info(Server, monitors),
 2156:     false = lists:member({process, Proc}, GMonitors),
 2157: 
 2158:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2159:     stop_node(B),
 2160:     init_condition(Config),
 2161:     ok.
 2162: 
 2163: otp_5640_proc(_Parent) ->
 2164:     receive 
 2165:         die ->
 2166:             exit(normal)
 2167:     end.
 2168: 
 2169: %% OTP-5737. set_lock/3 and trans/4 accept Retries = 0.
 2170: otp_5737(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2171:     Timeout = 25,
 2172:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2173:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2174:     init_condition(Config),
 2175: 
 2176:     LockId = {?MODULE,self()},
 2177:     Nodes = [node()],
 2178:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:set_lock(LockId, Nodes, -1)),
 2179:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:set_lock(LockId, Nodes, a)),
 2180:     true = global:set_lock(LockId, Nodes, 0),
 2181:     Time1 = erlang:timestamp(),
 2182:     false = global:set_lock({?MODULE,not_me}, Nodes, 0),
 2183:     true = timer:now_diff(erlang:timestamp(), Time1) < 5000,
 2184:     _ = global:del_lock(LockId, Nodes),
 2185: 
 2186:     Fun = fun() -> ok end,
 2187:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:trans(LockId, Fun, Nodes, -1)),
 2188:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:trans(LockId, Fun, Nodes, a)),
 2189:     ok = global:trans(LockId, Fun, Nodes, 0),
 2190: 
 2191:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2192:     init_condition(Config),
 2193:     ok.
 2194: 
 2195: connect_all_false(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2196:     %% OTP-6931. Ignore nodeup when connect_all=false.
 2197:     connect_all_false_test("-connect_all false", Config),
 2198:     %% OTP-17934: multipl -connect_all false and kernel parameter connect_all
 2199:     connect_all_false_test("-connect_all false -connect_all false", Config),
 2200:     connect_all_false_test("-kernel connect_all false", Config),
 2201:     ok.
 2202: 
 2203: connect_all_false_test(CAArg, Config) ->
 2204:     Me = self(),
 2205:     {ok, CAf} = start_non_connecting_node(ca_false, Config),
 2206:     {ok, false} = rpc:call(CAf, application, get_env, [kernel, connect_all]),
 2207:     ok = rpc:call(CAf, error_logger, add_report_handler, [?MODULE, Me]),
 2208:     info = rpc:call(CAf, error_logger, warning_map, []),
 2209:     {global_name_server,CAf} ! {nodeup, fake_node, #{connection_id => 4711}},
 2210:     timer:sleep(100),
 2211:     stop_node(CAf),
 2212:     receive {nodeup,fake_node, _} ->
 2213:             ct:fail({info_report, was, sent})
 2214:     after 1000 -> ok
 2215:     end,
 2216:     ok.
 2217: 
 2218: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2219: %%% Testing a disconnected node. Not two partitions.
 2220: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2221: %% OTP-5563. Disconnected nodes (not partitions).
 2222: simple_disconnect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2223:     Timeout = 30,
 2224:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2225:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2226:     init_condition(Config),
 2227:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2228: 
 2229:     %% Three nodes (test_server, n_1, n_2). 
 2230:     [Cp1, Cp2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, n_2], peer, Config),
 2231:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2232: 
 2233:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 2234: 
 2235:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2236: 
 2237:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, []) end,Nodes),
 2238: 
 2239:     Name = name,
 2240:     Resolver = {no_module, resolve_none}, % will never be called
 2241:     PingNode = Cp2,
 2242: 
 2243:     {_Pid1, yes} =
 2244:         rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_resolver, [Name, Resolver]),
 2245:     ct:sleep(100),
 2246: 
 2247:     %% Disconnect test_server and Cp2. 
 2248:     disconnect_nodes(PartCtrlr, node(), Cp2),
 2249:     %% We might have been disconnected from Cp1 as well. Ensure connected
 2250:     %% to Cp1...
 2251:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp1),
 2252: 
 2253:     %% _Pid is registered on Cp1. The exchange of names between Cp2 and
 2254:     %% test_server sees two identical pids.
 2255:     pong = net_adm:ping(PingNode),
 2256: 
 2257:     ?UNTIL(Cps =:= lists:sort(nodes())),
 2258: 
 2259:     {_, Trace0} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2260:     Resolvers = [P || {_Node,new_resolver,{pid,P}} <- Trace0],
 2261:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2262:     true = undefined /= global:whereis_name(Name),
 2263:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> P ! die end, Resolvers),
 2264:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> wait_for_exit(P) end, Resolvers),
 2265:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2266:     undefined = global:whereis_name(Name),
 2267: 
 2268:     {_, Trace1} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2269:     Trace = Trace0 ++ Trace1, 
 2270:     [] = [foo || {_, resolve_none, _, _} <- Trace],
 2271: 
 2272:     Gs = name_servers(Nodes),
 2273:     [_, _, _] = monitored_by_node(Trace, Gs),
 2274: 
 2275:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, []) end, Nodes),
 2276: 
 2277:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2278:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2279:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 2280:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2281:     init_condition(Config),
 2282:     ok.
 2283: 
 2284: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2285: %%% Testing resolve of name. Many combinations with four nodes.
 2286: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2287: -record(cf, {
 2288:           link,  % node expected to have registered process running
 2289:           ping,  % node in partition 2 to be pinged
 2290:           n1,    % node starting registered process in partition 1
 2291:           n2,    % node starting registered process in partition 2
 2292:           nodes, % nodes expected to exist after ping
 2293:           n_res, % expected number of resolvers after ping
 2294:           config,
 2295:           ctrlr
 2296:          }).
 2297: 
 2298: -define(RES(F), {F, fun ?MODULE:F/3}).
 2299: 
 2300: %% OTP-5563. Partitions and names.
 2301: simple_resolve(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2302:     Timeout = 360,
 2303:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2304:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2305:     init_condition(Config),
 2306:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2307: 
 2308:     [N1, A2, Z2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, a_2, z_2], peer, Config),
 2309:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2310:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2311: 
 2312:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 2313: 
 2314:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> 
 2315:                           rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, [])
 2316:                   end, Nodes),
 2317: 
 2318:     %% There used to be a link between global_name_server and the
 2319:     %% registered name. Now there are only monitors, but the field
 2320:     %% name 'link' remains...
 2321: 
 2322:     Cf = #cf{link = none, ping = A2, n1 = node(), n2 = A2,
 2323:              nodes = [node(), N1, A2, Z2], n_res = 2, config = Config,
 2324:              ctrlr = PartCtrlr},
 2325: 
 2326:     %% There is no test with a resolver that deletes a pid (like
 2327:     %% global_exit_name does). The resulting DOWN signal just clears
 2328:     %% out the pid from the tables, which should be harmless. So all
 2329:     %% tests are done with resolvers that keep both processes. This
 2330:     %% should catch all cases which used to result in bogus process
 2331:     %% links (now: only monitors are used).
 2332: 
 2333:     %% Two partitions are created in each case below: [node(), n_1]
 2334:     %% and [a_2, z_2]. A name ('name') is registered in both
 2335:     %% partitions whereafter node() or n_1 pings a_2 or z_2. Note that
 2336:     %% node() = test_server, which means that node() < z_2 and node()
 2337:     %% > a_2. The lesser node calls the resolver.
 2338: 
 2339:     %% [The following comment does not apply now that monitors are used.]
 2340:     %% The resolver is run on a_2 with the process on node()
 2341:     %% as first argument. The process registered as 'name' on a_2 is
 2342:     %% removed from the tables. It is unlinked from a_2, and the new
 2343:     %% process (on node()) is inserted without trying to link to it
 2344:     %% (it it known to run on some other node, in the other
 2345:     %% partition). The new process is not sent to the other partition
 2346:     %% for update since it already exists there.
 2347:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2}),
 2348:     %% The same, but the z_2 takes the place of a_2.
 2349:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = Z2}),
 2350:     %% The resolver is run on test_server. 
 2351:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2352:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2353:     %% Now the same tests but with n_1 taking the place of test_server.
 2354:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2355:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2356:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2357:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2358: 
 2359:     %% [Maybe this set of tests is the same as (ismorphic to?) the last one.]
 2360:     %% The resolver is run on a_2 with the process on node()
 2361:     %% as first argument. The process registered as 'name' on a_2 is
 2362:     %% the one kept. The old process is unlinked on node(), and the
 2363:     %% new process (on a_2) is inserted without trying to link to it
 2364:     %% (it it known to run on some other node).
 2365:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n2 = A2}),
 2366:     %% The same, but the z_2 takes the place of a_2.
 2367:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n2 = Z2}),
 2368:     %% The resolver is run on test_server. 
 2369:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2370:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2371:     %% Now the same tests but with n_1 taking the place of test_server.
 2372:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2373:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2374:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2375:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2376: 
 2377:     %% A resolver that does not return one of the pids.
 2378:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = A2}),
 2379:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = Z2}),
 2380:     %% The resolver is run on test_server. 
 2381:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2382:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2383:     %% Now the same tests but with n_1 taking the place of test_server.
 2384:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2385:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2386:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2387:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2388: 
 2389:     %% Both processes are unlinked (demonitored).
 2390:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = A2}),
 2391:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = Z2}),
 2392:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2393:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2394:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2395:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2396:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2397:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2398: 
 2399:     %% A resolver faking badrpc. The resolver is run on a_2, and the
 2400:     %% process on node() is kept.
 2401:     res(?RES(badrpc_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2}),
 2402: 
 2403:     %% An exiting resolver. A kind of badrpc.
 2404:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2}),
 2405:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = Z2}),
 2406:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2407:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2408:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2409:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2410:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2411:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2412: 
 2413:     %% A locker that takes a lock. It used to be that the
 2414:     %% global_name_server was busy exchanging names, which caused a
 2415:     %% deadlock.
 2416:     res(?RES(lock_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node()}),
 2417: 
 2418:     %% A resolver that disconnects from the node of the first pid
 2419:     %% once. The nodedown message is processed (the resolver killed),
 2420:     %% then a new attempt (nodeup etc.) is made. This time the
 2421:     %% resolver does not disconnect any node.
 2422:     res(?RES(disconnect_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n2 = Z2,
 2423: 					   nodes = [node(), N1, A2, Z2]}),
 2424: 
 2425:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 2426: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 2427: 		  end, Nodes),
 2428: 
 2429:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2430:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2431:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 2432:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2433:     init_condition(Config),
 2434:     ok.
 2435: 
 2436: %% OTP-5563. Partitions and names.
 2437: simple_resolve2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2438:     %% Continuation of simple_resolve. Of some reason it did not
 2439:     %% always work to re-start z_2. "Cannot be a global bug."
 2440: 
 2441:     Timeout = 30,
 2442:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2443:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2444:     init_condition(Config),
 2445:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2446: 
 2447:     [N1, A2, Z2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, a_2, z_2], peer, Config),
 2448:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2449:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2450: 
 2451:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 2452: 
 2453:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> 
 2454:                           rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, [])
 2455:                   end, Nodes),
 2456: 
 2457:     Cf = #cf{link = none, ping = A2, n1 = node(), n2 = A2,
 2458:              nodes = [node(), N1, A2, Z2], n_res = 2, config = Config,
 2459:              ctrlr = PartCtrlr},
 2460: 
 2461:     %% Halt z_2. 
 2462:     res(?RES(halt_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping  = A2,
 2463: 				      nodes = [node(), N1, A2], n_res = 1}),
 2464: 
 2465:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 2466: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 2467: 		  end, Nodes),
 2468: 
 2469:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2470:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2471:     stop_nodes(Cps), % Not all nodes may be present, but it works anyway.
 2472:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2473:     init_condition(Config),
 2474:     ok.
 2475: 
 2476: %% OTP-5563. Partitions and names.
 2477: simple_resolve3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2478:     %% Continuation of simple_resolve.
 2479: 
 2480:     Timeout = 30,
 2481:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2482:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2483:     init_condition(Config),
 2484:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2485: 
 2486:     [N1, A2, Z2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, a_2, z_2], peer, Config),
 2487:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2488:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2489: 
 2490:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 2491: 
 2492:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> 
 2493:                           rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, [])
 2494:                   end, Nodes),
 2495: 
 2496:     Cf = #cf{link = none, ping = A2, n1 = node(), n2 = A2,
 2497:              nodes = [node(), N1, A2, Z2], n_res = 2, config = Config,
 2498:              ctrlr = PartCtrlr},
 2499: 
 2500:     %% Halt a_2. 
 2501:     res(?RES(halt_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2, 
 2502:                                       nodes = [node(), N1], n_res = 1}),
 2503: 
 2504:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 2505: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 2506: 		  end, Nodes),
 2507: 
 2508:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2509:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2510:     stop_nodes(Cps), % Not all nodes may be present, but it works anyway.
 2511:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2512:     init_condition(Config),
 2513:     ok.
 2514: 
 2515: res({Res,Resolver}, [N1, A2, Z2], Cf) ->
 2516:     %% Note: there are no links anymore, but monitors.
 2517:     #cf{link = LinkedNode, ping = PingNode, n1 = Res1, n2 = OtherNode,
 2518:         nodes = Nodes0, n_res = NRes, config = Config, ctrlr = PartCtrlr} = Cf,
 2519:     io:format("~n~nResolver: ~p", [Res]),
 2520:     io:format(" Registered on partition 1:  ~p", [Res1]),
 2521:     io:format(" Registered on partition 2:  ~p", [OtherNode]),
 2522:     io:format(" Pinged node:                ~p", [PingNode]),
 2523:     io:format(" Linked node:                ~p", [LinkedNode]),
 2524:     io:format(" Expected # resolvers:       ~p", [NRes]),
 2525:     Nodes = lists:sort(Nodes0),
 2526:     T1 = node(),
 2527:     Part1 = [T1, N1],
 2528:     Part2 = [A2, Z2],
 2529:     Name = name,
 2530: 
 2531:     %% A registered name is resolved in different scenarios with just
 2532:     %% four nodes. In each scenario it is checked that exactly the
 2533:     %% expected monitors remain between registered processes and the
 2534:     %% global_name_server.
 2535: 
 2536:     setup_partitions(PartCtrlr, [Part1, Part2]),
 2537: 
 2538:     erpc:call(PartCtrlr,
 2539:               fun () ->
 2540:                       erpc:call(OtherNode,
 2541:                                 fun () ->
 2542:                                         {Pid2, yes} = start_resolver(Name,
 2543:                                                                      Resolver),
 2544:                                         trace_message({node(), part_2_2,
 2545:                                                        nodes(), {pid2,Pid2}})
 2546:                                 end)
 2547:               end),
 2548: 
 2549:     {_Pid1, yes} =
 2550:         rpc:call(Res1, ?MODULE, start_resolver, [Name, Resolver]),
 2551: 
 2552:     pong = net_adm:ping(PingNode),
 2553:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 2554: 
 2555:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2556:     case global:whereis_name(Name) of
 2557: 	undefined when LinkedNode =:= none -> ok;
 2558: 	Pid -> assert_pid(Pid)
 2559:     end,
 2560: 
 2561:     {_, Trace0} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2562:     Resolvers = [P || {_Node,new_resolver,{pid,P}} <- Trace0],
 2563: 
 2564:     NRes = length(Resolvers),
 2565: 
 2566:     %% Wait for extra monitor processes to be created.
 2567:     %% This applies as long as global:do_monitor/1 spawns processes.
 2568:     %% (Some day monitor() will be truly synchronous.)
 2569:     ct:sleep(100),
 2570: 
 2571:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> P ! die end, Resolvers),
 2572:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> wait_for_exit(P) end, Resolvers),
 2573: 
 2574:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2575:     undefined = global:whereis_name(Name),
 2576: 
 2577:     %% Wait for monitors to remove names.
 2578:     ct:sleep(100),
 2579: 
 2580:     {_, Trace1} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2581:     Trace = Trace0 ++ Trace1, 
 2582: 
 2583:     Gs = name_servers([T1, N1, A2, Z2]),
 2584:     MonitoredByNode = monitored_by_node(Trace, Gs),
 2585:     MonitoredBy = [M || {_N,M} <- MonitoredByNode],
 2586: 
 2587:     X = MonitoredBy -- Gs,
 2588:     LengthGs = length(Gs),
 2589:     case MonitoredBy of
 2590: 	[] when LinkedNode =:= none -> ok;
 2591: 	Gs -> ok;
 2592: 	_ when LengthGs < 4, X =:= [] -> ok;
 2593: 	_ -> io:format("ERROR:~nMonitoredBy ~p~n"
 2594: 		       "global_name_servers ~p~n",
 2595: 		       [MonitoredByNode, Gs]),
 2596: 	     ct:fail(monitor_mismatch)
 2597:     end,
 2598:     ok.
 2599: 
 2600: name_servers(Nodes) ->
 2601:     lists:sort([rpc:call(N, erlang, whereis, [global_name_server]) || 
 2602:                    N <- Nodes,
 2603:                    pong =:= net_adm:ping(N)]).
 2604: 
 2605: monitored_by_node(Trace, Servers) ->
 2606:     lists:sort([{node(M),M} || 
 2607:                    {_Node,_P,died,{monitors_2levels,ML}} <- Trace, 
 2608:                    M <- ML,
 2609:                    lists:member(M, Servers)]).
 2610: 
 2611: resolve_first(name, Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2612:     Pid1.
 2613: 
 2614: resolve_second(name, _Pid1, Pid2) ->
 2615:     Pid2.
 2616: 
 2617: resolve_none(name, _Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2618:     none.
 2619: 
 2620: bad_resolver(name, _Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2621:     bad_answer.
 2622: 
 2623: badrpc_resolver(name, _Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2624:     {badrpc, badrpc}.
 2625: 
 2626: exit_resolver(name, _Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2627:     erlang:error(bad_resolver).
 2628: 
 2629: lock_resolver(name, Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2630:     Id = {?MODULE, self()},
 2631:     Nodes = [node()],
 2632:     true = global:set_lock(Id, Nodes),
 2633:     _ = global:del_lock(Id, Nodes),
 2634:     Pid1.
 2635: 
 2636: disconnect_first(name, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 2637:     Name = disconnect_first_name,
 2638:     case whereis(Name) of
 2639:         undefined -> 
 2640:             spawn(fun() -> disconnect_first_name(Name) end),
 2641:             true = erlang:disconnect_node(node(Pid1));
 2642:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 2643:             Pid ! die
 2644:     end,
 2645:     Pid2.
 2646: 
 2647: disconnect_first_name(Name) ->
 2648:     register(Name, self()),
 2649:     receive die -> ok end.
 2650: 
 2651: halt_second(name, _Pid1, Pid2) ->
 2652:     rpc:call(node(Pid2), erlang, halt, []),
 2653:     Pid2.
 2654: 
 2655: start_resolver(Name, Resolver) ->
 2656:     Self = self(), 
 2657:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> init_resolver(Self, Name, Resolver) end),
 2658:     trace_message({node(), new_resolver, {pid, Pid}}),
 2659:     receive
 2660: 	{Pid, Res} -> {Pid, Res}
 2661:     end.
 2662: 
 2663: init_resolver(Parent, Name, Resolver) ->
 2664:     X = global:register_name(Name, self(), Resolver),
 2665:     Parent ! {self(), X},
 2666:     loop_resolver().
 2667: 
 2668: loop_resolver() ->
 2669:     receive
 2670:         die ->
 2671:             trace_message({node(), self(), died, mon_by_servers(self())}),
 2672:             exit(normal)
 2673:     end.
 2674: 
 2675: %% The server sometimes uses an extra process for monitoring. 
 2676: %% The server monitors that extra process.
 2677: mon_by_servers(Proc) ->
 2678:     {monitored_by, ML} = process_info(Proc, monitored_by),
 2679:     {monitors_2levels, 
 2680:      lists:append([ML | 
 2681:                    [begin
 2682:                         {monitored_by, MML} = rpc:call(node(M), 
 2683:                                                        erlang, 
 2684:                                                        process_info, 
 2685:                                                        [M, monitored_by]),
 2686:                         MML
 2687:                     end || M <- ML]])}.
 2688: 
 2689: -define(REGNAME, contact_a_2).
 2690: 
 2691: %% OTP-5563. Bug: nodedown while syncing.
 2692: leftover_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2693:     Timeout = 30,
 2694:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2695:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2696:     init_condition(Config),
 2697:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2698:     [N1, A2, Z2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, a_2, z_2], peer,  Config),
 2699:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2700:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2701: 
 2702:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> 
 2703:                           rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, [])
 2704:                   end, Nodes),
 2705: 
 2706:     Name = name, % registered on a_2
 2707:     ResName = resolved_name, % registered on n_1 and a_2
 2708:     %% 
 2709:     _Pid = ping_a_2_fun(?REGNAME, N1, A2),
 2710: 
 2711:     T1 = node(),
 2712:     Part1 = [T1, N1],
 2713:     Part2 = [A2, Z2],
 2714:     NoResolver = {no_module, resolve_none},
 2715:     Resolver = fun contact_a_2/3,
 2716: 
 2717:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [Part1, Part2]),
 2718: 
 2719:     erpc:call(
 2720:       PartCtrlr,
 2721:       fun () ->
 2722:               erpc:call(
 2723:                 A2,
 2724:                 fun () ->
 2725:                         lists:foreach(
 2726:                           fun({TheName, TheResolver}) ->
 2727:                                   {Pid2, yes} = start_resolver(TheName, TheResolver),
 2728:                                   trace_message({node(), part_2_2, nodes(), {pid2,Pid2}})
 2729:                           end, [{Name, NoResolver}, {ResName, Resolver}])
 2730:                 end)
 2731:       end),
 2732: 
 2733:     %% resolved_name is resolved to run on a_2, an insert operation is
 2734:     %% sent to n_1. The resolver function halts a_2, but the nodedown
 2735:     %% message is handled by n_1 _before_ the insert operation is run
 2736:     %% (at least every now and then; sometimes it seems to be
 2737:     %% delayed). Unless "artificial" nodedown messages are sent the
 2738:     %% name would linger on indefinitely. [There is no test case for
 2739:     %% the situation that no nodedown message at all is sent.]
 2740:     {_Pid1, yes} =
 2741:         rpc:call(N1, ?MODULE, start_resolver, 
 2742:                  [ResName, fun contact_a_2/3]),
 2743:     ct:sleep(1000),
 2744: 
 2745:     trace_message({node(), pinging, z_2}),
 2746:     pong = net_adm:ping(Z2),
 2747:     ?UNTIL((Nodes -- [A2]) =:= lists:sort(?NODES)),
 2748:     ct:sleep(1000),
 2749: 
 2750:     {_,Trace0} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2751: 
 2752:     Resolvers = [P || {_Node,new_resolver,{pid,P}} <- Trace0],
 2753:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> P ! die end, Resolvers),
 2754:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> wait_for_exit(P) end, Resolvers),
 2755: 
 2756:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 2757: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 2758: 		  end, Nodes),
 2759: 
 2760:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 2761:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2762:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 2763:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2764:     init_condition(Config),
 2765:     ok.
 2766: 
 2767: %% Runs on n_1
 2768: contact_a_2(resolved_name, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 2769:     trace_message({node(), ?REGNAME, {pid1,Pid1}, {pid2,Pid2}, 
 2770: 		   {node1,node(Pid1)}, {node2,node(Pid2)}}),
 2771:     ?REGNAME ! doit,
 2772:     Pid2.
 2773: 
 2774: ping_a_2_fun(RegName, N1, A2) ->
 2775:     spawn(N1, fun() -> ping_a_2(RegName, N1, A2) end).
 2776: 
 2777: ping_a_2(RegName, N1, A2) ->
 2778:     register(RegName, self()),
 2779:     receive doit -> 
 2780:             trace_message({node(), ping_a_2, {a2, A2}}),
 2781:             monitor_node(A2, true),
 2782:             %% Establish contact with a_2, then take it down.
 2783:             rpc:call(N1, ?MODULE, halt_node, [A2]),
 2784:             receive
 2785:                 {nodedown, A2} -> ok
 2786:             end
 2787:     end.
 2788: 
 2789: halt_node(Node) ->
 2790:     rpc:call(Node, erlang, halt, []).
 2791: 
 2792: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2793: %%% Testing re-registration of a name.
 2794: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2795: %% OTP-5563. Name is re-registered.
 2796: re_register_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2797:     %% When re-registering a name the link to the old pid used to
 2798:     %% linger on. Don't think is was a serious bug though--some memory
 2799:     %% occupied by links, that's all.
 2800:     %% Later: now monitors are checked.
 2801:     Timeout = 15,
 2802:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2803:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2804:     init_condition(Config),
 2805:     Me = self(),
 2806:     Pid1 = spawn(fun() -> proc(Me) end),
 2807:     yes = global:register_name(name, Pid1),
 2808:     wait_for_monitor(Pid1),
 2809:     Pid2 = spawn(fun() -> proc(Me) end),
 2810:     _ = global:re_register_name(name, Pid2),
 2811:     wait_for_monitor(Pid2),
 2812:     Pid2 ! die,
 2813:     Pid1 ! die,
 2814:     receive {Pid1, MonitoredBy1} -> [] = MonitoredBy1 end,
 2815:     receive {Pid2, MonitoredBy2} -> [_] = MonitoredBy2 end,
 2816:     _ = global:unregister_name(name),
 2817:     init_condition(Config),
 2818:     ok.
 2819: 
 2820: wait_for_monitor(Pid) ->
 2821:     case process_info(Pid, monitored_by) of
 2822:         {monitored_by, []} ->
 2823:             timer:sleep(1),
 2824:             wait_for_monitor(Pid);
 2825:         {monitored_by, [_]} ->
 2826:             ok
 2827:     end.
 2828: 
 2829: proc(Parent) ->
 2830:     receive die -> ok end,
 2831:     {monitored_by, MonitoredBy} = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 2832:     Parent ! {self(), MonitoredBy}.
 2833: 
 2834: 
 2835: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2836: %%% 
 2837: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2838: %% OTP-5563. Registered process dies.
 2839: name_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2840:     StartFun = fun() ->
 2841:                        {ok, N1} = start_node_rel(n_1, this, Config),
 2842:                        {ok, N2} = start_node_rel(n_2, this, Config),
 2843:                        [N1, N2]
 2844:                end,
 2845:     io:format("Test of current release~n"),
 2846:     do_name_exit(StartFun, current, Config).
 2847: 
 2848: do_name_exit(StartFun, Version, Config) ->
 2849:     %% When a registered process dies, the node where it is registered
 2850:     %% removes the name from the table immediately, and then removes
 2851:     %% it from other nodes using a lock.
 2852:     %% This is perhaps not how it should work, but it is not easy to
 2853:     %% change.
 2854:     %% See also OTP-3737.
 2855:     %%
 2856:     %% The current release uses monitors so this test is not so relevant.
 2857: 
 2858:     Timeout = 60,
 2859:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2860:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2861:     init_condition(Config),
 2862:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2863: 
 2864:     %% Three nodes (test_server, n_1, n_2). 
 2865:     Cps = StartFun(),
 2866:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2867:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2868:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, []) end,Nodes),
 2869: 
 2870:     Name = name,
 2871:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(Name),
 2872: 
 2873:     Me = self(),
 2874:     LL = spawn(fun() -> long_lock(Me) end),
 2875:     receive 
 2876:         long_lock_taken -> ok
 2877:     end,
 2878: 
 2879:     Pid ! die,                    
 2880:     wait_for_exit_fast(Pid),
 2881: 
 2882:     ct:sleep(100),
 2883:     %% Name has been removed from node()'s table, but nowhere else
 2884:     %% since there is a lock on 'global'.
 2885:     {R1,[]} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, global, whereis_name, [Name]),
 2886:     case Version of
 2887: 	old -> [_,_] = lists:usort(R1);
 2888: 	current -> [undefined, undefined, undefined] = R1
 2889:     end,
 2890:     ct:sleep(3000),
 2891:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2892: 
 2893:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, []) end, Nodes),
 2894:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2895:     exit(LL, kill),
 2896:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2897:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 2898:     init_condition(Config),
 2899:     ok.
 2900: 
 2901: long_lock(Parent) ->
 2902:     global:trans({?GLOBAL_LOCK,self()}, 
 2903:                  fun() -> 
 2904:                          Parent ! long_lock_taken,
 2905:                          timer:sleep(3000) 
 2906:                  end).
 2907: 
 2908: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2909: %%% Testing the support for external nodes (cnodes)
 2910: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2911: %% OTP-5563. External nodes (cnodes).
 2912: external_nodes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2913:     Timeout = 30,
 2914:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2915:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2916:     init_condition(Config),
 2917:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2918: 
 2919:     [NodeB, NodeC] = start_nodes([b, c], peer, Config),
 2920:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2921: 
 2922:     %% Nodes = ?NODES,
 2923:     %% lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, []) end,
 2924:     %%               Nodes),
 2925:     Name = name,
 2926: 
 2927:     %% Two partitions: [test_server] and [b, c].
 2928:     %% c registers an external name on b
 2929: 
 2930:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node()], [NodeB, NodeC]]),
 2931: 
 2932:     erpc:call(
 2933:       PartCtrlr,
 2934:       fun () ->
 2935:               erpc:call(
 2936:                 NodeB,
 2937:                 fun () ->
 2938:                         Pid = spawn(NodeC, fun() -> cnode_proc(NodeB) end),
 2939:                         Pid ! {register, self(), Name},
 2940:                         receive {Pid, Reply} -> yes = Reply end,
 2941:                         erpc:call(NodeC, erlang, register, [Name, Pid])
 2942:                 end)
 2943:       end),
 2944: 
 2945:     pong = net_adm:ping(NodeB),
 2946:     ?UNTIL([NodeB, NodeC] =:= lists:sort(nodes())),
 2947:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2948: 
 2949:     Cpid = rpc:call(NodeC, erlang, whereis, [Name]),
 2950:     ExternalName = [{name,Cpid,NodeB}],
 2951:     ExternalName = get_ext_names(),
 2952:     ExternalName = rpc:call(NodeB, gen_server, call,
 2953: 			    [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 2954:     ExternalName = rpc:call(NodeC, gen_server, call,
 2955: 			    [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 2956: 
 2957:     [_] = cnode_links(Cpid),
 2958:     [_,_,_] = cnode_monitored_by(Cpid),
 2959:     no = global:register_name(Name, self()),
 2960:     yes = global:re_register_name(Name, self()),
 2961:     ?UNTIL([] =:= cnode_monitored_by(Cpid)),
 2962:     ?UNTIL([] =:= cnode_links(Cpid)),
 2963:     [] = gen_server:call(global_name_server, get_names_ext, infinity),
 2964: 
 2965:     Cpid ! {register, self(), Name},
 2966:     receive {Cpid, Reply1} -> no = Reply1 end,
 2967:     _ = global:unregister_name(Name),
 2968:     ct:sleep(1000),
 2969:     Cpid ! {register, self(), Name},
 2970:     ?UNTIL(length(get_ext_names()) =:= 1),
 2971:     receive {Cpid, Reply2} -> yes = Reply2 end,
 2972: 
 2973:     Cpid ! {unregister, self(), Name},
 2974:     ?UNTIL(length(get_ext_names()) =:= 0),
 2975:     receive {Cpid, Reply3} -> ok = Reply3 end,
 2976: 
 2977:     Cpid ! die,
 2978:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 2979:     [] = get_ext_names(),
 2980:     [] = rpc:call(NodeB, gen_server, call,
 2981: 		  [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 2982:     [] = rpc:call(NodeC, gen_server, call,
 2983: 		  [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 2984: 
 2985:     Cpid2 = erlang:spawn(NodeC, fun() -> cnode_proc(NodeB) end),
 2986:     Cpid2 ! {register, self(), Name},
 2987:     receive {Cpid2, Reply4} -> yes = Reply4 end,
 2988: 
 2989:     %% It could be a bug that Cpid2 is linked to 'global_name_server'
 2990:     %% at node 'b'. The effect: Cpid2 dies when node 'b' crashes.
 2991:     stop_node(NodeB),
 2992:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 2993:     [] = get_ext_names(),
 2994:     [] = rpc:call(NodeC, gen_server, call,
 2995: 		  [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 2996: 
 2997:     %% {_, Trace} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2998:     %% lists:foreach(fun(M) -> erlang:display(M) end, Trace),
 2999: 
 3000:     ThisNode = node(),
 3001:     Cpid3 = erlang:spawn(NodeC, fun() -> cnode_proc(ThisNode) end),
 3002:     Cpid3 ! {register, self(), Name},
 3003:     receive {Cpid3, Reply5} -> yes = Reply5 end,
 3004: 
 3005:     ?UNTIL(length(get_ext_names()) =:= 1),
 3006:     stop_node(NodeC),
 3007:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 3008:     ?UNTIL(length(get_ext_names()) =:= 0),
 3009: 
 3010:     init_condition(Config),
 3011:     ok.
 3012: 
 3013: get_ext_names() ->
 3014:     gen_server:call(global_name_server, get_names_ext, infinity).
 3015: 
 3016: cnode_links(Pid) ->
 3017:     Pid ! {links, self()},
 3018:     receive 
 3019:         {links, Links} ->
 3020:             Links
 3021:     end.
 3022: 
 3023: cnode_monitored_by(Pid) ->
 3024:     Pid ! {monitored_by, self()},
 3025:     receive 
 3026:         {monitored_by, MonitoredBy} ->
 3027:             MonitoredBy
 3028:     end.
 3029: 
 3030: cnode_proc(E) ->
 3031:     receive
 3032:         {register, From, Name} ->
 3033:             Rep = rpc:call(E, global, register_name_external, [Name, self()]),
 3034:             From ! {self(), Rep};
 3035:         {unregister, From, Name} ->
 3036:             _ = rpc:call(E, global, unregister_name_external, [Name]),
 3037:             From ! {self(), ok};
 3038:         {links, From} ->
 3039:             From ! process_info(self(), links);
 3040:         {monitored_by, From} ->
 3041:             From ! process_info(self(), monitored_by);
 3042:         die ->
 3043:             exit(normal)
 3044:     end,
 3045:     cnode_proc(E).
 3046: 
 3047: 
 3048: %% OTP-5770. Start many nodes. Make them connect at the same time.
 3049: many_nodes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3050:     Timeout = 240,
 3051:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 3052:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 3053:     init_condition(Config),
 3054:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 3055: 
 3056:     {Rels, N_cps} = 
 3057:         case os:type() of
 3058:             {unix, Osname} when Osname =:= linux; 
 3059:                                 Osname =:= openbsd; 
 3060:                                 Osname =:= darwin ->
 3061:                 N_nodes = quite_a_few_nodes(32),
 3062:                 {node_rel(1, N_nodes), N_nodes};
 3063:             {unix, _} ->
 3064:                 {node_rel(1, 32), 32};
 3065:             _ -> 
 3066:                 {node_rel(1, 32), 32}
 3067:         end,
 3068:     Cps = [begin {ok, Cp} = start_node_rel(Name, Rel, Config), Cp end ||
 3069: 	      {Name,Rel} <- Rels],
 3070:     Nodes = lists:sort(?NODES),
 3071:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 3072: 
 3073:     %% All nodes isolated not connected to any other (visible) nodes...
 3074:     Partitions = [[node()] | lists:map(fun (Node) -> [Node] end, Cps)],
 3075: 
 3076:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, Partitions),
 3077: 
 3078:     Time = msec(),
 3079: 
 3080:     erpc:call(
 3081:       PartCtrlr,
 3082:       fun () ->
 3083:               OkRes = lists:map(fun (_) -> {ok, ok} end, Cps),
 3084:               OkRes = erpc:multicall(
 3085:                         Cps,
 3086:                         fun () ->
 3087:                                 lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 3088:                                                       _ = net_adm:ping(N)
 3089:                                               end, shuffle(Cps)),
 3090:                                 ?UNTIL((Cps -- get_known(node())) =:= []),
 3091:                                 ok
 3092:                         end),
 3093:               ok
 3094:       end),
 3095: 
 3096:     Time2 = msec(),
 3097: 
 3098:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> pong = net_adm:ping(N) end, Cps),
 3099: 
 3100:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 3101: 
 3102:     write_high_level_trace(Config), % The test succeeded, but was it slow?
 3103: 
 3104:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 3105:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 3106:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 3107:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 3108:     init_condition(Config),
 3109:     Diff = Time2 - Time,
 3110:     Return = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w nodes took ~w ms", 
 3111:                                          [N_cps, Diff])),
 3112:     erlang:display({{nodes,N_cps},{time,Diff}}),
 3113:     io:format("~s~n", [Return]),
 3114:     {comment, Return}.
 3115: 
 3116: node_rel(From, To) ->
 3117:     NodeNumbers = lists:seq(From, To),
 3118:     Release = erlang:system_info(otp_release),
 3119:     LastRelease = integer_to_list(list_to_integer(Release) - 1) ++ "_latest",
 3120:     Last = case test_server:is_release_available(LastRelease) of
 3121:                true -> list_to_atom(LastRelease);
 3122:                false -> this
 3123:            end,
 3124:     [{lists:concat([cp, N]),
 3125:       case N rem 2 of
 3126:           0 -> this;
 3127:           1 -> Last
 3128:       end} || N <- NodeNumbers].
 3129: 
 3130: touch(File, List) ->
 3131:     ok = file:write_file(File, list_to_binary(List)).
 3132: 
 3133: append_to_file(File, Term) ->
 3134:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [raw,binary,append]),
 3135:     ok = file:write(Fd, io_lib:format("~p.~n", [Term])),
 3136:     ok = file:close(Fd).
 3137: 
 3138: file_contents(File, ContentsList, Config) ->
 3139:     file_contents(File, ContentsList, Config, no_log_file).
 3140: 
 3141: file_contents(File, ContentsList, Config, LogFile) ->
 3142:     Contents = list_to_binary(ContentsList),    
 3143:     Sz = size(Contents),
 3144:     ?UNTIL(begin
 3145:                case file:read_file(File) of
 3146:                    {ok, FileContents}=Reply -> 
 3147:                        case catch split_binary(FileContents, Sz) of
 3148:                            {Contents,_} ->
 3149:                                true;
 3150:                            _ ->
 3151:                                catch append_to_file(LogFile,
 3152:                                                     {File,Contents,Reply}),
 3153:                                false
 3154:                        end;
 3155:                    Reply ->
 3156:                        catch append_to_file(LogFile, {File, Contents, Reply}),
 3157:                        false
 3158:                end
 3159:            end).
 3160: 
 3161: shuffle(L) ->
 3162:     [E || {_, E} <- lists:keysort(1, [{rand:uniform(), E} || E <- L])].
 3163: 
 3164: %% OTP-5770. sync/0.
 3165: sync_0(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3166:     Timeout = 180,
 3167:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 3168:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 3169:     init_condition(Config),
 3170: 
 3171:     N_cps = 
 3172:         case os:type() of
 3173:             {unix, Osname} when Osname =:= linux; 
 3174:                                 Osname =:= openbsd; 
 3175:                                 Osname =:= darwin ->
 3176:                 quite_a_few_nodes(30);
 3177:             {unix, sunos} ->
 3178:                 30;
 3179:             {unix, _} ->
 3180:                 16;
 3181:             _ -> 
 3182:                 30
 3183:         end,
 3184: 
 3185:     Names = [lists:concat([cp,N]) || N <- lists:seq(1, N_cps)],
 3186:     Cps = start_and_sync(Names),
 3187:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 3188:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 3189:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 3190: 
 3191:     init_condition(Config),
 3192:     ok.
 3193: 
 3194: start_and_sync([]) ->
 3195:     [];
 3196: start_and_sync([Name | Names]) ->
 3197:     {ok, N} = start_node(Name, slave, []),
 3198:     {Time, _Void} = rpc:call(N, timer, tc, [global, sync, []]),
 3199:     io:format("~p: ~p~n", [Name, Time]),
 3200:     [N | start_and_sync(Names)].
 3201: 
 3202: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 3203: %%% Testing of change of global_groups parameter.
 3204: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 3205: %% Test change of global_groups parameter.
 3206: global_groups_change(Config) ->
 3207:     Timeout = 90,
 3208:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 3209:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 3210:     init_condition(Config),
 3211:     M = from($@, atom_to_list(node())),
 3212: 
 3213:     %% Create the .app files and the boot script
 3214:     {KernelVer, StdlibVer} = create_script_dc("dc"),
 3215:     case is_real_system(KernelVer, StdlibVer) of
 3216: 	true ->
 3217: 	    Options = [];
 3218: 	false  ->
 3219: 	    Options = [local]
 3220:     end,
 3221: 
 3222:     ok = systools:make_script("dc", Options),
 3223: 
 3224:     [Ncp1,Ncp2,Ncp3,Ncp4,Ncp5,NcpA,NcpB,NcpC,NcpD,NcpE] = 
 3225:         node_names([cp1,cp2,cp3,cp4,cp5,cpA,cpB,cpC,cpD,cpE], Config),
 3226: 
 3227:     %% Write config files
 3228:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 3229:     {ok, Fd_dc} = file:open(filename:join(Dir, "sys.config"), [write]),
 3230:     config_dc1(Fd_dc, Ncp1, Ncp2, Ncp3, NcpA, NcpB, NcpC, NcpD, NcpE),
 3231:     file:close(Fd_dc),
 3232:     Config1 = filename:join(Dir, "sys"),
 3233: 
 3234:     %% Test [cp1, cp2, cp3]

 3236:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node_boot(Ncp2, Config1, dc),
 3237:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node_boot(Ncp3, Config1, dc),
 3238:     {ok, CpA} = start_node_boot(NcpA, Config1, dc),
 3239:     {ok, CpB} = start_node_boot(NcpB, Config1, dc),
 3240:     {ok, CpC} = start_node_boot(NcpC, Config1, dc),
 3241:     {ok, CpD} = start_node_boot(NcpD, Config1, dc),
 3242:     {ok, CpE} = start_node_boot(NcpE, Config1, dc),

 3244:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp2]),
 3245:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp3]),

 3247: 		    [list_to_atom(lists:concat(["cp5@", M]))]),
 3248:     pong = rpc:call(Cp2, net_adm, ping, [Cp3]),

 3250: 		    [list_to_atom(lists:concat(["cp5@", M]))]),

 3570:     stop_node(CpB),
 3571:     stop_node(CpC),
 3572:     stop_node(CpD),
 3573:     stop_node(CpE),
 3574:

 3576:     ok.
 3577: 
 3578: gg_sync_and_wait(Node, Synced, SyncError, NoContact) ->
 3579:     ok = rpc:call(Node, global_group, sync, []),
 3580:     gg_wait(Node, Synced, SyncError, NoContact).
 3581: 
 3582: gg_wait(Node, Synced, SyncError, NoContact) ->
 3583:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 3584:     try
 3585:         GGInfo = rpc:call(Node, global_group, info, []),
 3586:         ct:pal("GG info: ~p~n", [GGInfo]),
 3587:         case proplists:lookup(synced_nodes, GGInfo) of
 3588:             {synced_nodes, Synced} -> ok;
 3589:             _ -> throw(wait)
 3590:         end,
 3591:         case proplists:lookup(sync_error, GGInfo) of
 3592:             {sync_error, SyncError} -> ok;
 3593:             _ -> throw(wait)
 3594:         end,
 3595:         case proplists:lookup(no_contact, GGInfo) of
 3596:             {no_contact, NoContact} -> ok;
 3597:             _ -> throw(wait)
 3598:         end
 3599:     catch
 3600:         throw:wait ->
 3601:             gg_wait(Node, Synced, SyncError, NoContact)
 3602:     end.
 3603: 
 3604: %%% Copied from init_SUITE.erl.
 3605: is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) ->
 3606:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
 3607:     filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir,  "kernel-" ++ KernelVsn))
 3608: 	andalso
 3609: 	filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir,  "stdlib-" ++ StdlibVsn)).
 3610: 
 3611: create_script_dc(ScriptName) ->
 3612:     Name = filename:join(".", ScriptName),
 3613:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
 3614:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel,1,Apps),
 3615:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib,1,Apps),
 3616:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 3617:     {_, Version} = init:script_id(),
 3618:     io:format(Fd,
 3619: 	      "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"~s\"}, \n"
 3620: 	      " {erts, \"4.4\"}, \n"
 3621: 	      " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"}]}.\n",
 3622: 	      [Version, KernelVer, StdlibVer]),
 3623:     file:close(Fd),
 3624:     {KernelVer, StdlibVer}.
