 3674: start_procs(Parent, N1, N2, N3, Config) ->
 3675:     S1 = lists:sort([N1, N2, N3]),
 3676:     ?UNTIL(begin
 3677: 	       NN = lists:sort(nodes()),
 3678: 	       S1 =:= NN
 3679: 	   end),
 3680:     Pid3 = start_proc3(test1),
 3681:     Pid4 = rpc:call(N1, ?MODULE, start_proc3, [test2]),
 3682:     assert_pid(Pid4),
 3683:     Pid5 = rpc:call(N2, ?MODULE, start_proc3, [test3]),
 3684:     assert_pid(Pid5),
 3685:     Pid6 = rpc:call(N3, ?MODULE, start_proc3, [test4]),
 3686:     assert_pid(Pid6),
 3687:     yes = global:register_name(test1, Pid3),
 3688:     yes = global:register_name(test2, Pid4, fun global:notify_all_name/3),
 3689:     yes = global:register_name(test3, Pid5, fun global:random_notify_name/3),
 3690:     Resolve = fun(Name, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 3691: 		      Parent ! {resolve_called, Name, node()},
 3692: 		      {Min, Max} = minmax(Pid1, Pid2),
 3693: 		      exit(Min, kill),
 3694: 		      Max
 3695: 	      end,
 3696:     yes = global:register_name(test4, Pid6, Resolve).
 3697: 
 3698: 
 3699: 
 3700: collect_resolves() -> cr(0).
 3701: cr(Res) ->
 3702:     receive
 3703: 	{resolve_called, Name, Node} ->
 3704: 	    ?P("resolve called: ~w ~w", [Name, Node]),
 3705:  	    cr(Res+1)
 3706:     after
 3707: 	0 -> Res
 3708:     end.
 3709: 
 3710: minmax(P1,P2) ->
 3711:     if node(P1) < node(P2) -> {P1, P2}; true -> {P2, P1} end.
 3712: 
 3713: fix_basic_name(name03, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 3714:     case atom_to_list(node(Pid1)) of
 3715: 	[$c, $p, $3|_] -> exit(Pid2, kill), Pid1;
 3716: 	_ -> exit(Pid1, kill), Pid2
 3717:     end;
 3718: fix_basic_name(name12, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 3719:     case atom_to_list(node(Pid1)) of
 3720: 	[$c, $p, $2|_] -> exit(Pid2, kill), Pid1;
 3721: 	_ -> exit(Pid1, kill), Pid2
 3722:     end.
 3723: 
 3724: start_proc() ->
 3725:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init, [self()]),
 3726:     receive
 3727: 	Pid -> Pid
 3728:     end.
 3729: 
 3730: 
 3731: start_proc(Name) ->
 3732:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init, [self(), Name]),
 3733:     receive
 3734: 	{Pid, Res} -> {Pid, Res}
 3735:     end.
 3736: 
 3737: start_proc2(Name) ->
 3738:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init2, [self(), Name]),
 3739:     receive
 3740: 	Pid -> Pid
 3741:     end.
 3742: 
 3743: start_proc3(Name) ->
 3744:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init, [self()]),
 3745:     register(Name, Pid),
 3746:     receive
 3747: 	Pid -> Pid
 3748:     end.
 3749: 
 3750: start_proc4(Name) ->
 3751:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init, [self()]),
 3752:     yes = global:register_name(Name, Pid),
 3753:     receive
 3754: 	Pid -> Pid
 3755:     end.
 3756: 
 3757: start_proc_basic(Name) ->
 3758:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, init_proc_basic, [self(), Name]),
 3759:     receive
 3760: 	{Pid, Res} -> {Pid, Res}
 3761:     end.
 3762: 
 3763: init_proc_basic(Parent, Name) ->
 3764:     X = global:register_name(Name, self(), fun ?MODULE:fix_basic_name/3),
 3765:     Parent ! {self(),X},
 3766:     loop().
 3767: 
 3768: single_node(Time, Node) ->
 3769:     spawn(?MODULE, init_2, []),
 3770:     timer:sleep(Time - msec()),
 3771:     _ = net_adm:ping(Node),
 3772:     ok.
 3773: 
 3774: init_2() ->
 3775:     register(single_name, self()),
 3776:     yes = global:register_name(single_name, self()),
 3777:     loop_2().
 3778: 
 3779: loop_2() ->
 3780:     receive
 3781: 	die -> ok
 3782:     end.
 3783: 
 3784: msec() ->
 3785:     msec(erlang:timestamp()).
 3786: 
 3787: msec(T) ->
 3788:     element(1,T)*1000000000 + element(2,T)*1000 + element(3,T) div 1000.
 3789: 
 3790: assert_pid(Pid) ->
 3791:     if
 3792: 	is_pid(Pid) -> true;
 3793: 	true -> exit({not_a_pid, Pid})
 3794:     end.
 3795: 
 3796: check_same([H|T]) -> check_same(T, H).
 3797: 
 3798: check_same([H|T], H) -> check_same(T, H);
 3799: check_same([], _H) -> ok.
 3800: 
 3801: check_same_p([H|T]) -> check_same_p(T, H).
 3802: 
 3803: check_same_p([H|T], H) -> check_same_p(T, H);
 3804: check_same_p([], _H) -> true;
 3805: check_same_p(_, _) -> false.
 3806: 
 3807: p_init(Parent) ->
 3808:     Parent ! self(),
 3809:     loop().
 3810: 
 3811: p_init(Parent, Name) ->
 3812:     X = global:register_name(Name, self()),
 3813:     Parent ! {self(),X},
 3814:     loop().
 3815: 
 3816: p_init2(Parent, Name) ->
 3817:     _ = global:re_register_name(Name, self()),
 3818:     Parent ! self(),
 3819:     loop().
 3820: 
 3821: req(Pid, Msg) ->
 3822:     Pid ! Msg,
 3823:     receive X -> X end.
 3824: 
 3825: sreq(Pid, Msg) ->
 3826:     Ref = make_ref(),
 3827:     Pid ! {Msg, Ref},
 3828:     receive {Ref, X} -> X end.
 3829: 
 3830: alone(N1, N2) ->
 3831:     ct:sleep(12000),
 3832:     net_adm:ping(N1),
 3833:     net_adm:ping(N2),
 3834:     yes = global:register_name(test5, self()).
 3835: 
 3836: crash(Time) ->
 3837:     %% ct:sleep/1 will not work because it calls a server process
 3838:     %% that does not run on other nodes.
 3839:     timer:sleep(Time),
 3840:     erlang:halt().
 3841: 
 3842: loop() ->
 3843:     receive
 3844: 	{ping, From} ->
 3845: 	    From ! {pong, node()},
 3846: 	    loop();
 3847: 	{del_lock, Id} ->
 3848: 	    global:del_lock({Id, self()}),
 3849: 	    loop();
 3850: 	{del_lock_sync, Id, From} ->
 3851: 	    global:del_lock({Id, self()}),
 3852: 	    From ! true,
 3853: 	    loop();
 3854: 	{del_lock, Id, Nodes} ->
 3855: 	    global:del_lock({Id, self()}, Nodes),
 3856: 	    loop();
 3857: 	{del_lock2, Id, From} ->
 3858: 	    global:del_lock(Id),
 3859: 	    From ! true,
 3860: 	    loop();
 3861: 	{del_lock2, Id, From, Nodes} ->
 3862: 	    global:del_lock(Id, Nodes),
 3863: 	    From ! true,
 3864: 	    loop();
 3865: 	{set_lock, Id, From} ->
 3866: 	    Res = global:set_lock({Id, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
 3867: 	    From ! Res,
 3868: 	    loop();
 3869: 	{set_lock, Id, From, Nodes} ->
 3870: 	    Res = global:set_lock({Id, self()}, Nodes, 1),
 3871: 	    From ! Res,
 3872: 	    loop();
 3873: 	{set_lock_loop, Id, From} ->
 3874: 	    true = global:set_lock({Id, self()}, ?NODES),
 3875: 	    From ! {got_lock, self()},
 3876: 	    loop();
 3877: 	{set_lock2, Id, From} ->
 3878: 	    Res = global:set_lock(Id, ?NODES, 1),
 3879: 	    From ! Res,
 3880: 	    loop();
 3881: 	{{got_notify, From}, Ref} ->
 3882: 	    receive
 3883: 		X when element(1, X) =:= global_name_conflict ->
 3884: 		    From ! {Ref, yes}
 3885: 	    after
 3886: 		0 -> From ! {Ref, no}
 3887: 	    end,
 3888: 	    loop();
 3889: 	die ->
 3890: 	    exit(normal);
 3891: 	drop_dead ->
 3892: 	    exit(drop_dead)
 3893:     end.
 3894: 
 3895: -ifdef(unused).
 3896: pr_diff(Str, T0, T1) ->
 3897:     Diff = begin
 3898: 	       {_, {H,M,S}} = calendar:time_difference(T0, T1),
 3899: 	       ((H*60+M)*60)+S
 3900: 	   end,
 3901:     ct:pal(?HI_VERBOSITY,"~13s: ~w (diff: ~w)",[Str, T1, Diff]),
 3902:     if
 3903: 	Diff > 100 ->
 3904: 	    io:format(1,"~s: ** LARGE DIFF ~w~n", [Str, Diff]);
 3905: 	true -> 
 3906: 	    ok
 3907:     end.
 3908: -endif.	    
 3909: 
 3910: now_diff({A1,B1,C1},{A2,B2,C2}) ->
 3911:     C1-C2 + 1000000*((B1-B2) + 1000000*(A1-A2)).
 3912: 
 3913: start_node_boot(Name, Config, Boot) ->
 3914:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 3915:     Res = test_server:start_node(Name, peer, [{args, " -pa " ++ Pa ++ 
 3916: 						   " -config " ++ Config ++
 3917: 						   " -boot " ++ atom_to_list(Boot)}]),
 3918:     record_started_node(Res).
 3919: 
 3920: %% Increase the timeout for when an upcoming connection is teared down
 3921: %% again (default is 7 seconds, and can be exceeded by some tests).
 3922: %% The default remains in effect for the test_server node itself, though.
 3923: start_node(Name, Config) ->
 3924:     start_node(Name, slave, Config).
 3925: 
 3926: start_hidden_node(Name, Config) ->
 3927:     start_node(Name, slave, "-hidden", Config).
 3928: 
 3929: start_non_connecting_node(Name, Config) ->
 3930:     start_node(Name, slave, "-connect_all false +W i", Config).
 3931: 
 3932: start_peer_node(Name, Config) ->
 3933:     start_node(Name, peer, Config).
 3934: 
 3935: start_node(Name, How, Config) ->
 3936:     start_node(Name, How, "", Config).
 3937: 
 3938: start_node(Name0, How, Args, Config) ->
 3939:     Name = node_name(Name0, Config),
 3940:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 3941:     R = test_server:start_node(
 3942:           Name, How, [{args,
 3943:                        Args ++
 3944:                            " -kernel net_setuptime 100 " ++
 3945:                            %% Limit the amount of threads so that we
 3946:                            %% don't run into the maximum allowed
 3947:                            " +S 1 +SDio 1 " ++
 3948:                            %% "-noshell "
 3949:                            "-pa " ++ Pa},
 3950:                       {linked, false}
 3951:                      ]),
 3952:     %% {linked,false} only seems to work for slave nodes.
 3953:     %%    ct:sleep(1000),
 3954:     record_started_node(R).
 3955: 
 3956: start_node_rel(Name0, Rel, Config) ->
 3957:     Name = node_name(Name0, Config),
 3958:     {Release, Compat} = case Rel of
 3959:                             this ->
 3960:                                 {[this], ""};
 3961:                             Rel when is_atom(Rel) ->
 3962:                                 {[{release, atom_to_list(Rel)}], ""};
 3963:                             RelList ->
 3964: 				{RelList, ""}
 3965: 			end,
 3966:     Env = [],
 3967:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 3968:     Res = test_server:start_node(
 3969:             Name, peer,
 3970:             [{args,
 3971:               Compat ++
 3972:                   " -kernel net_setuptime 100 " ++
 3973:                   %% Limit the amount of threads so that we
 3974:                   %% don't run into the maximum allowed
 3975:                   " +S 1 +SDio 1 " ++
 3976:                   "-pa " ++ Pa},
 3977:              {erl, Release}] ++ Env),
 3978:     record_started_node(Res).
 3979: 
 3980: record_started_node({ok, Node}) ->
 3981:     node_started(Node),
 3982:     case erase(?nodes_tag) of
 3983:         undefined -> ok;
 3984:         Nodes -> put(?nodes_tag, [Node | Nodes])
 3985:     end,
 3986:     {ok, Node};
 3987: record_started_node(R) ->
 3988:     R.
 3989: 
 3990: node_names(Names, Config) ->
 3991:     [node_name(Name, Config) || Name <- Names].
 3992: 
 3993: %% simple_resolve assumes that the node name comes first.
 3994: node_name(Name, Config) ->
 3995:     U = "_",
 3996:     {{Y,M,D}, {H,Min,S}} = calendar:now_to_local_time(erlang:timestamp()),
 3997:     Date = io_lib:format("~4w_~2..0w_~2..0w__~2..0w_~2..0w_~2..0w", 
 3998:                          [Y,M,D, H,Min,S]),
 3999:     L = lists:flatten(Date),
 4000:     lists:concat([Name,U,?testcase,U,U,L]).
 4001: 
 4002: stop_nodes(Nodes) ->
 4003:     lists:foreach(fun(Node) -> stop_node(Node) end, Nodes).
 4004: 
 4005: stop_node(Node) ->
 4006:     Res = test_server:stop_node(Node),
 4007:     node_stopped(Node),
 4008:     Res.
 4009: 
 4010: 
 4011: stop() ->
 4012:     lists:foreach(fun(Node) ->
 4013: 			  test_server:stop_node(Node),
 4014:                           node_stopped(Node)
 4015: 		  end, nodes()).
 4016: 
 4017: %% Tests that locally loaded nodes do not loose contact with other nodes.
 4018: global_lost_nodes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4019:     Timeout = 60,
 4020:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4021:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 4022:     init_condition(Config),
 4023: 
 4024:     {ok, Node1} = start_node(node1, Config),
 4025:     {ok, Node2} = start_node(node2, Config),
 4026: 
 4027:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 4028: 
 4029:     io:format("Nodes: ~p", [nodes()]),
 4030:     io:format("Nodes at node1: ~p",
 4031: 	      [rpc:call(Node1, erlang, nodes, [])]),
 4032:     io:format("Nodes at node2: ~p",
 4033: 	      [rpc:call(Node2, erlang, nodes, [])]),
 4034: 
 4035:     rpc_cast(Node1, ?MODULE, global_load, [node_1,Node2,node_2]),
 4036:     rpc_cast(Node2, ?MODULE, global_load, [node_2,Node1,node_1]),
 4037: 
 4038:     lost_nodes_waiter(Node1, Node2),
 4039: 
 4040:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 4041:     stop_node(Node1),
 4042:     stop_node(Node2),
 4043:     init_condition(Config),
 4044:     ok.    
 4045: 
 4046: global_load(MyName, OtherNode, OtherName) ->
 4047:     yes = global:register_name(MyName, self()),
 4048:     io:format("Registered ~p",[MyName]),
 4049:     global_load1(OtherNode, OtherName, 0).
 4050: 
 4051: global_load1(_OtherNode, _OtherName, 2) ->
 4052:     io:format("*** ~p giving up. No use.", [node()]),
 4053:     init:stop();
 4054: global_load1(OtherNode, OtherName, Fails) ->	
 4055:     ct:sleep(1000),
 4056:     case catch global:whereis_name(OtherName) of
 4057: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 4058: 	    io:format("~p says: ~p is still there.",
 4059: 		      [node(),OtherName]),
 4060: 	    global_load1(OtherNode, OtherName, Fails);
 4061: 	Other ->
 4062: 	    io:format("~p says: ~p is lost (~p) Pinging.",
 4063: 		      [ node(), OtherName, Other]),
 4064: 	    case net_adm:ping(OtherNode) of
 4065: 		pong ->
 4066: 		    io:format("Re-established contact to ~p",
 4067: 			      [OtherName]);
 4068: 		pang ->
 4069: 		    io:format("PANIC! Other node is DEAD.", []),
 4070: 		    init:stop()
 4071: 	    end,
 4072: 	    global_load1(OtherNode, OtherName, Fails+1)
 4073:     end.
 4074: 
 4075: lost_nodes_waiter(N1, N2) ->
 4076:     net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true),
 4077:     receive
 4078: 	{nodedown, Node} when Node =:= N1 ; Node =:= N2 ->
 4079: 	    io:format("~p went down!",[Node]),
 4080: 	    ct:fail("Node went down.")
 4081:     after 10000 ->
 4082: 	    ok
 4083:     end,
 4084:     ok.
 4085: 
 4086: 
 4087: 
 4088: %% Tests the simultaneous death of many processes with registered names.
 4089: mass_death(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4090:     Timeout = 90,
 4091:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4092:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 4093:     init_condition(Config),
 4094:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 4095:     %% Start nodes
 4096:     Cps = [cp1,cp2,cp3,cp4,cp5],
 4097:     Nodes = [begin {ok, Node} = start_node(Cp, Config), Node end ||
 4098: 		Cp <- Cps],
 4099:     io:format("Nodes: ~p~n", [Nodes]),
 4100:     Ns = lists:seq(1, 40),
 4101:     %% Start processes with globally registered names on the nodes
 4102:     {Pids,[]} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, ?MODULE, init_mass_spawn, [Ns]),
 4103:     io:format("Pids: ~p~n", [Pids]),
 4104:     %% Wait...
 4105:     ct:sleep(10000),
 4106:     %% Check the globally registered names
 4107:     NewNames = global:registered_names(),
 4108:     io:format("NewNames: ~p~n", [NewNames]),
 4109:     Ndiff = lists:sort(NewNames--OrigNames),
 4110:     io:format("Ndiff: ~p~n", [Ndiff]),
 4111:     Ndiff = lists:sort(mass_names(Nodes, Ns)),
 4112:     %%
 4113:     %% Kill the root pids
 4114:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) -> Pid ! drop_dead end, Pids),
 4115:     %% Start probing and wait for all registered names to disappear
 4116:     {YYYY,MM,DD} = date(),
 4117:     {H,M,S} = time(),
 4118:     io:format("Started probing: ~.4.0w-~.2.0w-~.2.0w ~.2.0w:~.2.0w:~.2.0w~n",
 4119: 	      [YYYY,MM,DD,H,M,S]),
 4120:     wait_mass_death(Nodes, OrigNames, erlang:timestamp(), Config).
 4121: 
 4122: wait_mass_death(Nodes, OrigNames, Then, Config) ->
 4123:     Names = global:registered_names(),
 4124:     case Names--OrigNames of
 4125: 	[] ->
 4126: 	    T = now_diff(erlang:timestamp(), Then) div 1000,
 4127: 	    lists:foreach(
 4128: 	      fun (Node) ->
 4129: 		      stop_node(Node)
 4130: 	      end, Nodes),
 4131: 	    init_condition(Config),
 4132: 	    {comment,lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~.3f s~n", [T/1000.0]))};
 4133: 	Ndiff ->
 4134: 	    io:format("Ndiff: ~p~n", [Ndiff]),
 4135: 	    ct:sleep(1000),
 4136: 	    wait_mass_death(Nodes, OrigNames, Then, Config)
 4137:     end.
 4138: 
 4139: init_mass_spawn(N) ->
 4140:     Pid = mass_spawn(N),
 4141:     unlink(Pid),
 4142:     Pid.
 4143: 
 4144: mass_spawn([]) ->
 4145:     ok;
 4146: mass_spawn([N|T]) ->
 4147:     Parent = self(),
 4148:     Pid = 
 4149: 	spawn_link(
 4150: 	  fun () ->
 4151: 		  Name = mass_name(node(), N),
 4152: 		  yes = global:register_name(Name, self()),
 4153: 		  mass_spawn(T),
 4154: 		  Parent ! self(),
 4155: 		  loop()
 4156: 	  end),
 4157:     receive
 4158:         Pid ->
 4159:             Pid
 4160:     end.
 4161: 
 4162: mass_names([], _) ->
 4163:     [];
 4164: mass_names([Node|T],Ns) ->
 4165:     [mass_name(Node, N) || N <- Ns] ++ mass_names(T, Ns).
 4166: 
 4167: mass_name(Node, N) ->
 4168:     list_to_atom(atom_to_list(Node)++"_"++integer_to_list(N)).
 4169: 
 4170: 
 4171: 
 4172: start_nodes(L, How, Config) ->
 4173:     start_nodes2(L, How, 0, Config),
 4174:     Nodes = collect_nodes(0, length(L)),
 4175:     ?UNTIL([] =:= Nodes -- nodes()),
 4176:     put(?nodes_tag, Nodes),
 4177:     %% Pinging doesn't help, we have to wait too, for nodes() to become
 4178:     %% correct on the other node.
 4179:     lists:foreach(fun(E) ->
 4180: 			  net_adm:ping(E)
 4181: 		  end,
 4182: 		  Nodes),
 4183:     verify_nodes(Nodes, Config),
 4184:     Nodes.
 4185: 
 4186: %% Not used?
 4187: start_nodes_serially([], _, _Config) ->
 4188:     [];
 4189: start_nodes_serially([Name | Rest], How, Config) ->
 4190:     {ok, R} = start_node(Name, How, Config),
 4191:     [R | start_nodes_serially(Rest, How, Config)].
 4192: 
 4193: verify_nodes(Nodes, Config) ->
 4194:     verify_nodes(Nodes, lists:sort([node() | Nodes]), Config).
 4195: 
 4196: verify_nodes([], _N, _Config) ->
 4197:     [];
 4198: verify_nodes([Node | Rest], N, Config) ->
 4199:     ?UNTIL(
 4200:        case rpc:call(Node, erlang, nodes, []) of
 4201: 	   Nodes when is_list(Nodes) ->
 4202: 	       case N =:= lists:sort([Node | Nodes]) of
 4203: 		   true ->
 4204: 		       true;
 4205: 		   false ->
 4206: 		       lists:foreach(fun(Nd) ->
 4207: 					     rpc:call(Nd, net_adm, ping,
 4208:                                                       [Node])
 4209: 				     end,
 4210: 				     nodes()),
 4211: 		       false
 4212: 	       end;
 4213: 	   _ ->
 4214: 	       false
 4215:        end
 4216:       ),
 4217:     verify_nodes(Rest, N, Config).
 4218: 
 4219: 
 4220: start_nodes2([], _How, _, _Config) ->
 4221:     [];
 4222: start_nodes2([Name | Rest], How, N, Config) ->
 4223:     Self = self(),
 4224:     spawn(fun() ->
 4225: 		  erlang:display({starting, Name}),
 4226: 		  {ok, R} = start_node(Name, How, Config),
 4227: 		  erlang:display({started, Name, R}),
 4228: 		  Self ! {N, R},
 4229: 		  %% sleeping is necessary, or with peer nodes, they will
 4230: 		  %% go down again, despite {linked, false}.
 4231: 		  ct:sleep(100000)
 4232: 	  end),
 4233:     start_nodes2(Rest, How, N+1, Config).
 4234: 
 4235: collect_nodes(N, N) ->
 4236:     [];
 4237: collect_nodes(N, Max) ->
 4238:     receive
 4239: 	{N, Node} ->
 4240:             [Node | collect_nodes(N+1, Max)]
 4241:     end.
 4242: 
 4243: exit_p(Pid) ->
 4244:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 4245:     Pid ! die,
 4246:     receive
 4247: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, _Reason} ->
 4248: 	    ok
 4249:     end.
 4250: 
 4251: wait_for_exit(Pid) ->
 4252:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 4253:     receive
 4254: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, _Reason} ->
 4255: 	    ok
 4256:     end.
 4257: 
 4258: wait_for_exit_fast(Pid) ->
 4259:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 4260:     receive
 4261: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, _Reason} ->
 4262: 	    ok
 4263:     end.
 4264: 
 4265: check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config) ->
 4266:     ?UNTIL(begin
 4267: 	       case rpc:multicall(Nodes, global, whereis_name, [Name]) of
 4268: 		   {Ns1, []} ->
 4269: 		       check_same_p(Ns1);
 4270: 		   _R ->
 4271: 		       false
 4272: 	       end
 4273: 	   end).
 4274: 
 4275: init_condition(Config) ->
 4276:     io:format("globally registered names: ~p~n", [global:registered_names()]),
 4277:     io:format("nodes: ~p~n", [nodes()]),
 4278:     io:format("known: ~p~n", [get_known(node()) -- [node()]]),
 4279:     io:format("Info ~p~n", [setelement(10, global:info(), trace)]),
 4280:     _ = [io:format("~s: ~p~n", [TN, ets:tab2list(T)]) ||
 4281:             {TN, T} <- [{"Global Names     (ETS)", global_names},
 4282:                         {"Global Names Ext (ETS)", global_names_ext},
 4283:                         {"Global Locks     (ETS)", global_locks},
 4284:                         {"Global Pid Names (ETS)", global_pid_names},
 4285:                         {"Global Pid Ids   (ETS)", global_pid_ids}]],
 4286:     ?UNTIL([] =:= global:registered_names()),
 4287:     ?UNTIL([] =:= nodes()),
 4288:     ?UNTIL([node()] =:= get_known(node())),
 4289:     ok.
 4290: 
 4291: mk_node(N, H) when is_list(N), is_list(H) ->
 4292:     list_to_atom(N ++ "@" ++ H).
 4293: 
 4294: remove_gg_pub_type([]) ->
 4295:     [];
 4296: remove_gg_pub_type([{GG, Nodes}|Rest]) ->
 4297:     [{GG, Nodes}|remove_gg_pub_type(Rest)];
 4298: remove_gg_pub_type([{GG, _, Nodes}|Rest]) ->
 4299:     [{GG, Nodes}|remove_gg_pub_type(Rest)].
 4300: 
 4301: %% Send garbage message to all processes that are linked to global.
 4302: %% Better do this in a slave node.
 4303: %% (The transition from links to monitors does not affect this case.)
 4304: 
 4305: garbage_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4306:     Timeout = 25,
 4307:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4308:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 4309:     init_condition(Config),
 4310:     [Slave] = start_nodes([garbage_messages], slave, Config),
 4311:     Fun = fun() ->
 4312: 		  {links,L} = process_info(whereis(global_name_server), links),
 4313: 		  lists:foreach(fun(Pid) -> Pid ! {garbage,to,you} end, L),
 4314: 		  receive
 4315: 		      _Any -> ok
 4316: 		  end
 4317: 	  end,
 4318:     Pid = spawn_link(Slave, erlang, apply, [Fun,[]]),
 4319:     ct:sleep(2000),
 4320:     Global = rpc:call(Slave, erlang, whereis, [global_name_server]),
 4321:     {registered_name,global_name_server} =
 4322: 	rpc:call(Slave, erlang, process_info, [Global,registered_name]),
 4323:     true = unlink(Pid),
 4324:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 4325:     stop_node(Slave),
 4326:     init_condition(Config),
 4327:     ok.
 4328: 
 4329: %% This is scenario outlined in
 4330: %% https://erlang.org/pipermail/erlang-questions/2020-October/100034.html.
 4331: %% It illustrates that the algorithm of Global is flawed.
 4332: %%
 4333: %% This has been worked around by global actively disconnecting nodes
 4334: %% to prevent overlapping partitions (OTP-17843).
 4335: flaw1(Config) ->
 4336:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
 4337:         true ->
 4338:             flaw1_test(Config);
 4339:         false ->
 4340:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions disabled"}
 4341:     end.
 4342: 
 4343: flaw1_test(Config) ->
 4344:     Timeout = 360,
 4345:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4346:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 4347:     init_condition(Config),
 4348:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 4349: 
 4350:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 4351: 
 4352:     [A, B, C, D] = OtherNodes = start_nodes([a, b, c, d], peer, Config),
 4353:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | OtherNodes]),
 4354:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 4355: 
 4356:     F1 =
 4357:         fun(S0) ->
 4358:                 ct:sleep(100),
 4359:                 Str = "************",
 4360:                 S = Str ++ "  " ++ lists:flatten(S0) ++ "  " ++ Str,
 4361:                 io:format("~s\n", [S]),
 4362:                 erpc:call(
 4363:                   PartCtrlr,
 4364:                   fun () ->
 4365:                           [begin
 4366:                                RNs = erpc:call(N, global, registered_names, []),
 4367:                                W = erpc:call(N, global, whereis_name, [x]),
 4368:                                io:format("   === ~w ===\n", [N]),
 4369:                                io:format("       registered names: ~p", [RNs]),
 4370:                                io:format("       where is x:       ~p", [W])
 4371:                            end || N <- OtherNodes]
 4372:                   end)
 4373:         end,
 4374:     F1("start"),
 4375: 
 4376:     disconnect_nodes(PartCtrlr, A, C),
 4377:     F1("after disconnecting c from a"),
 4378: 
 4379:     Me = self(),
 4380:     IdleFun = fun () ->
 4381:                       Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Me),
 4382:                       receive
 4383:                           {'DOWN', Mon, process, Me, _} ->
 4384:                               exit(normal)
 4385:                       end
 4386:               end,
 4387:     Pid = spawn(IdleFun),
 4388:     yes = rpc:call(A, global, register_name, [x, Pid]),
 4389:     F1(io_lib:format("after registering x as ~p on a", [Pid])),
 4390: 
 4391:     disconnect_nodes(PartCtrlr, B, D),
 4392:     F1("after disconnecting d from b"),
 4393: 
 4394:     Pid2 = spawn(IdleFun),
 4395:     yes = rpc:call(B, global, re_register_name, [x, Pid2]),
 4396:     F1(io_lib:format("after re_register_name x as ~p on b", [Pid2])),
 4397: 
 4398:     pong = rpc:call(A, net_adm, ping, [C]),
 4399:     F1("finished after ping c from a"),
 4400: 
 4401:     pong = rpc:call(B, net_adm, ping, [D]),
 4402:     F1("finished after ping d from b"),
 4403: 
 4404:     timer:sleep(1000),
 4405: 
 4406:     check_everywhere(Nodes, x, Config),
 4407:     F1("After check everywhere"),
 4408: 
 4409:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(x)),
 4410: 
 4411:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 4412: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 4413: 		  end, Nodes),
 4414:     _ = rpc:call(A, global, unregister_name, [x]),
 4415: 
 4416:     F1("after unregistering x on node a"),
 4417: 
 4418:     %% _ = rpc:call(B, global, unregister_name, [y]),
 4419:     %% F1("after unregistering y on node b"),
 4420: 
 4421:     ct:sleep(100),
 4422:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 4423:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 4424:     stop_nodes(OtherNodes),
 4425:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 4426:     init_condition(Config),
 4427:     ok.
 4428: 
 4429: global_disconnect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4430:     Timeout = 30,
 4431:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4432: 
 4433:     [] = nodes(connected),
 4434: 
 4435:     {ok, H1} = start_hidden_node(h1, Config),
 4436:     {ok, H2} = start_hidden_node(h2, Config),
 4437:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, peer, Config),
 4438:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, peer, Config),
 4439:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, peer, Config),
 4440: 
 4441:     ThisNode = node(),
 4442:     HNodes = lists:sort([H1, H2]),
 4443:     OtherGNodes = lists:sort([Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]),
 4444:     AllGNodes = lists:sort([ThisNode|OtherGNodes]),
 4445: 
 4446:     lists:foreach(fun (Node) -> pong = net_adm:ping(Node) end, OtherGNodes),
 4447: 
 4448:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 4449: 
 4450:     ok = erpc:call(
 4451:            H2,
 4452:            fun () ->
 4453:                    lists:foreach(fun (Node) ->
 4454:                                          pong = net_adm:ping(Node)
 4455:                                  end, OtherGNodes)
 4456:            end),
 4457: 
 4458:     lists:foreach(
 4459:       fun (Node) ->
 4460:               AllGNodes = erpc:call(
 4461:                             H1,
 4462:                             fun () ->
 4463:                                     erpc:call(
 4464:                                       Node,
 4465:                                       fun () ->
 4466:                                               lists:sort([node()|nodes()])
 4467:                                       end)
 4468:                             end),
 4469:               HNodes = erpc:call(
 4470:                          H1,
 4471:                          fun () ->
 4472:                                  erpc:call(
 4473:                                    Node,
 4474:                                    fun () ->
 4475:                                            lists:sort(nodes(hidden))
 4476:                                    end)
 4477:                          end)
 4478:       end, AllGNodes),
 4479: 
 4480:     OtherGNodes = lists:sort(global:disconnect()),
 4481: 
 4482:     GNodesAfterDisconnect = nodes(),
 4483: 
 4484:     HNodes = lists:sort(nodes(hidden)),
 4485: 
 4486:     lists:foreach(fun (Node) ->
 4487:                           false = lists:member(Node, GNodesAfterDisconnect)
 4488:                   end,
 4489:                   OtherGNodes),
 4490: 
 4491:     %% Wait a while giving the other nodes time to react to the disconnects
 4492:     %% before we check that everything is as expected...
 4493:     receive after 2000 -> ok end,
 4494: 
 4495:     lists:foreach(
 4496:       fun (Node) ->
 4497:               OtherGNodes = erpc:call(
 4498:                               H1,
 4499:                               fun () ->
 4500:                                       erpc:call(
 4501:                                         Node,
 4502:                                         fun () ->
 4503:                                                 lists:sort([node()|nodes()])
 4504:                                         end)
 4505:                               end),
 4506:               HNodes = erpc:call(
 4507:                          H1,
 4508:                          fun () ->
 4509:                                  erpc:call(
 4510:                                    Node,
 4511:                                    fun () ->
 4512:                                            lists:sort(nodes(hidden))
 4513:                                    end)
 4514:                          end)
 4515:       end, OtherGNodes),
 4516: 
 4517:     stop_node(Cp1),
 4518:     stop_node(Cp2),
 4519:     stop_node(Cp3),
 4520:     stop_node(H1),
 4521:     stop_node(H2),
 4522: 
 4523:     ok.
 4524: 
 4525: %% ---
 4526: 
 4527: wait_for_ready_net(Config) ->
 4528:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 4529:                                         wait_for_ready_net(?NODES, Config)
 4530:                                 end),
 4531:     wait_for_ready_net_loop(Pid, MRef).
 4532: 
 4533: wait_for_ready_net_loop(Pid, MRef) ->
 4534:     receive
 4535:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Info} ->
 4536:             ?P("wait-for-ready-net process terminated: "
 4537:                "~n      ~p", [Info]),
 4538:             ok;
 4539: 
 4540:         {'EXIT', ParentPid, {timetrap_timeout, _Timeout, _Stack}} ->
 4541:             ?P("wait-for-ready-net -> received timetrap timeout:"
 4542:                "~n   Regarding: ~p"
 4543:                "~n   Waiter:    ~p"
 4544:                "~n      Current Location: ~p"
 4545:                "~n      Dictionary:       ~p"
 4546:                "~n      Messages:          ~p",
 4547:                [ParentPid, Pid,
 4548:                 pi(Pid, current_location),
 4549:                 pi(Pid, dictionary),
 4550:                 pi(Pid, messages)]),
 4551:             exit(Pid, kill),
 4552:             ct:fail("Timeout waiting for ready network")
 4553: 
 4554:     end.
 4555: 
 4556: wait_for_ready_net(Nodes0, Config) ->
 4557:     Nodes = lists:sort(Nodes0),
 4558:     ?P("wait_for_ready_net ->"
 4559:        "~n   Nodes: ~p", [Nodes]),
 4560:     ?UNTIL(begin
 4561:                lists:all(fun(N) ->
 4562:                                  ?P("wait_for_ready_net -> "
 4563:                                     "get known (by global) for ~p", [N]),
 4564:                                  GNs = get_known(N),
 4565:                                  ?P("wait_for_ready_net -> verify same for ~p:"
 4566:                                     "~n   Global Known: ~p"
 4567:                                     "~n   Nodes:        ~p", [N, GNs, Nodes]),
 4568:                                  GRes = Nodes =:= GNs,
 4569:                                  ?P("wait_for_ready_net => ~p", [GRes]),
 4570:                                  GRes
 4571:                          end,
 4572:                          Nodes) and
 4573: 		   lists:all(fun(N) ->
 4574:                                      ?P("wait_for_ready_net -> "
 4575:                                         "get erlang nodes for ~p", [N]),
 4576: 				     case rpc:call(N, erlang, nodes, []) of
 4577:                                          RNs0 when is_list(RNs0) ->
 4578:                                              RNs = lists:sort([N | RNs0]),
 4579:                                              ?P("wait_for_ready_net -> "
 4580:                                                 "verify same for ~p: "
 4581:                                                 "~n   Remote nodes:  ~p"
 4582:                                                 "~n   (Local) Nodes: ~p",
 4583:                                                 [N, RNs, Nodes]),
 4584:                                              ERes = Nodes =:= RNs,
 4585:                                              ?P("wait_for_ready_net => ~p",
 4586:                                                 [ERes]),
 4587:                                              ERes;
 4588:                                          BadRes ->
 4589:                                              ?P("failed get nodes for ~p"
 4590:                                                 "~n      ~p",
 4591:                                                 [N, BadRes]),
 4592:                                              false
 4593:                                      end
 4594: 			     end,
 4595:                              Nodes)
 4596:            end).
 4597: 
 4598: get_known(Node) ->
 4599:     case catch gen_server:call({global_name_server,Node},get_known,infinity) of
 4600:         {'EXIT', _} ->
 4601:             [list, without, nodenames];
 4602:         Known when is_list(Known) -> 
 4603:             lists:sort([Node | Known])
 4604:     end.
 4605: 
 4606: quite_a_few_nodes(Max) ->
 4607:     N = try 
 4608:             ulimit("ulimit -u")
 4609:         catch _:_ ->
 4610: 		ulimit("ulimit -p") % can fail...
 4611:         end,
 4612:     lists:min([(N - 40) div 3, Max]).
 4613: 
 4614: ulimit(Cmd) ->
 4615:     N0 = os:cmd(Cmd),
 4616:     N1 = lists:reverse(N0),
 4617:     N2 = lists:dropwhile(fun($\r) -> true;
 4618: 			    ($\n) -> true;
 4619: 			    (_) -> false
 4620: 			 end, N1),
 4621:     case lists:reverse(N2) of
 4622:         "unlimited" -> 10000;
 4623:         N -> list_to_integer(N)
 4624:     end.
 4625: 
 4626: %% To make it less probable that some low-level problem causes
 4627: %% problems, the receiving node is ping:ed.
 4628: rpc_cast(Node, Module, Function, Args) ->
 4629:     {_,pong,Node}= {node(),net_adm:ping(Node),Node},
 4630:     rpc:cast(Node, Module, Function, Args).
 4631: 
 4632: global_known(Node) ->
 4633:     gen_server:call({global_name_server, Node}, get_known, infinity).
 4634: 
 4635: global_known() ->
 4636:     global_known(node()).
 4637: 
 4638: disconnect(Node) ->
 4639:     erlang:disconnect_node(Node),
 4640:     wait_until(fun () -> not lists:member(Node, global_known()) end),
 4641:     ok.
 4642: 
 4643: disconnect_nodes(HiddenCtrlNode, NodeA, NodeB) ->
 4644:     Nodes = [node()|nodes()],
 4645:     ok = erpc:call(HiddenCtrlNode,
 4646:                    fun () ->
 4647:                            ok = erpc:call(NodeA,
 4648:                                           fun () ->
 4649:                                                   disconnect(NodeB)
 4650:                                           end),
 4651:                            ok = erpc:call(NodeB,
 4652:                                           fun () ->
 4653:                                                   disconnect(NodeA)
 4654:                                           end),
 4655:                            %% Try to ensure 'lost_connection' messages
 4656:                            %% have been handled (see comment in
 4657:                            %% create_partitions)...
 4658:                            lists:foreach(fun (N) ->
 4659:                                                  _ = global_known(N)
 4660:                                          end, Nodes),
 4661:                            ok
 4662:                    end).
 4663: 
 4664: create_partitions(PartitionsList) ->
 4665:     AllNodes = lists:sort(lists:flatten(PartitionsList)),
 4666: 
 4667:     %% Take down all connections on all nodes...
 4668:     AllOk = lists:map(fun (_) -> {ok, ok} end, AllNodes),
 4669:     io:format("Disconnecting all nodes from eachother...", []),
 4670:     AllOk = erpc:multicall(
 4671:               AllNodes,
 4672:               fun () ->
 4673:                       lists:foreach(fun (N) ->
 4674:                                             erlang:disconnect_node(N)
 4675:                                     end, nodes()),
 4676:                       wait_until(fun () -> [] == global_known() end),
 4677:                       ok
 4678:               end, 5000),
 4679:     %% Here we know that all 'lost_connection' messages that will be
 4680:     %% sent by global name servers due to these disconnects have been
 4681:     %% sent, but we don't know that all of them have been received and
 4682:     %% handled. By communicating with all global name servers one more
 4683:     %% time it is very likely that all of them have been received and
 4684:     %% handled (however, not guaranteed). If 'lost_connection' messages
 4685:     %% are received after we begin to set up the partitions, the
 4686:     %% partitions may lose connection with some of its nodes.
 4687:     lists:foreach(fun (N) -> [] = global_known(N) end, AllNodes),
 4688: 
 4689:     %% Set up fully connected partitions...
 4690:     io:format("Connecting partitions...", []),
 4691:     lists:foreach(
 4692:       fun (Partition) ->
 4693:               Part = lists:sort(Partition),
 4694:               PartOk = lists:map(fun (_) -> {ok, ok} end, Part),
 4695:               PartOk = erpc:multicall(
 4696:                          Part,
 4697:                          fun () ->
 4698:                                  wait_until(
 4699:                                    fun () ->
 4700:                                            ConnNodes = Part -- [node()|nodes()],
 4701:                                            if ConnNodes == [] ->
 4702:                                                    true;
 4703:                                               true ->
 4704:                                                    lists:foreach(
 4705:                                                      fun (N) ->
 4706:                                                              net_kernel:connect_node(N)
 4707:                                                      end, ConnNodes),
 4708:                                                    false
 4709:                                            end
 4710:                                    end),
 4711:                                  ok
 4712:                                                         
 4713:                          end, 5000)
 4714:       end, PartitionsList),
 4715:     ok.
 4716:                                                      
 4717: setup_partitions(PartCtrlr, PartList) when is_atom(PartCtrlr) ->
 4718:     ok = erpc:call(PartCtrlr, fun () -> create_partitions(PartList) end),
 4719:     io:format("Partitions successfully setup:~n", []),
 4720:     lists:foreach(fun (Part) ->
 4721:                           io:format("~p~n", [Part])
 4722:                   end,
 4723:                   PartList),
 4724:     ok;
 4725: setup_partitions(Config, PartList) when is_list(Config) ->
 4726:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 4727:     setup_partitions(PartCtrlr, PartList),
 4728:     PartCtrlr.
 4729: 
 4730: start_partition_controller(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4731:     {ok, PartCtrlr} = start_hidden_node(part_ctrlr, Config),
 4732:     PartCtrlr.
 4733: 
 4734: stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr) ->
 4735:     stop_node(PartCtrlr).
 4736: 
 4737: prevent_overlapping_partitions() ->
 4738:     case application:get_env(kernel, prevent_overlapping_partitions) of
 4739:         {ok, false} ->
 4740:             false;
 4741:         _ ->
 4742:             true
 4743:     end.
 4744: 
 4745: cast_line([]) ->
 4746:     ok;
 4747: cast_line([N|Ns]) when N == node() ->
 4748:     cast_line(Ns);
 4749: cast_line([N|Ns]) ->
 4750:     erpc:cast(N, fun () -> cast_line(Ns) end).
 4751:                          
 4752: wait_until(F) ->
 4753:     case catch F() of
 4754:         true ->
 4755:             ok;
 4756:         _ ->
 4757:             receive after 10 -> ok end,
 4758:             wait_until(F)
 4759:     end.
 4760: 
 4761: 
 4762: %% The emulator now ensures that the node has been removed from
 4763: %% nodes().
 4764: rpc_disconnect_node(Node, DisconnectedNode, Config) ->
 4765:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, disconnect_node, [DisconnectedNode]),
 4766:     ?UNTIL
 4767:       (not lists:member(DisconnectedNode, rpc:call(Node, erlang, nodes, []))).
 4768: 
 4769: %%%
 4770: %%% Utility
 4771: %%%
 4772: 
 4773: %% It is a bit awkward to collect data from different nodes. One way
 4774: %% of doing is to use a named tracer process on each node. Interesting
 4775: %% data is banged to the tracer and when the test is finished data is
 4776: %% collected on some node by sending messages to the tracers. One
 4777: %% cannot do this if the net has been set up to be less than fully
 4778: %% connected. One can also prepare other modules, such as 'global', by
 4779: %% inserting lines like
 4780: %%   trace_message({node(), {at,?LINE}, {tag, message})
 4781: %% where appropriate.
 4782: 
 4783: start_tracer() ->
 4784:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> tracer([]) end),
 4785:     case catch register(my_tracer, Pid) of
 4786:         {'EXIT', _} ->
 4787:             ct:fail(re_register_my_tracer);
 4788:         _ ->
 4789:             ok
 4790:     end.
 4791: 
 4792: tracer(L) ->
 4793:     receive 
 4794:         %% {save, Term} ->
 4795:         %%     tracer([{erlang:timestamp(),Term} | L]);
 4796:         {get, From} ->
 4797:             From ! {trace, lists:reverse(L)},
 4798:             tracer([]);
 4799:         stop ->
 4800:             exit(normal);
 4801:         Term ->
 4802:             tracer([{erlang:timestamp(),Term} | L])
 4803:     end.
 4804: 
 4805: stop_tracer() ->
 4806:     trace_message(stop).
 4807: 
 4808: get_trace() ->
 4809:     trace_message({get, self()}),
 4810:     receive {trace, L} ->
 4811:             L
 4812:     end.
 4813: 
 4814: collect_tracers(Nodes) ->
 4815:     Traces0 = [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, get_trace, []) || N <- Nodes],
 4816:     Traces = [L || L <- Traces0, is_list(L)],
 4817:     try begin 
 4818:             Stamped = lists:keysort(1, lists:append(Traces)),
 4819:             NotStamped = [T || {_, T} <- Stamped],
 4820:             {Stamped, NotStamped}
 4821:         end
 4822:     catch _:_ -> {[], []}
 4823:     end.
 4824: 
 4825: trace_message(M) ->
 4826:     case catch my_tracer ! M of
 4827:         {'EXIT', _} ->
 4828:             ct:fail(my_tracer_not_registered);
 4829:         _ ->
 4830:             ok
 4831:     end.
 4832: 
 4833: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4834: 
 4835: pi(Item) ->
 4836:     pi(self(), Item).
 4837: pi(Pid, Item) ->
 4838:     {Item, Val} = process_info(Pid, Item),
 4839:     Val.
 4840:     
 4841: 
 4842: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4843: 
 4844: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 4845: %% The error_logger handler used for OTP-6931.
 4846: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 4847: init(Tester) ->
 4848:     {ok, Tester}.
 4849: 
 4850: handle_event({_, _GL, {_Pid,_String,[{nodeup,fake_node,_}=Msg]}}, Tester) ->
 4851:     Tester ! Msg,
 4852:     {ok, Tester};
 4853: handle_event(_Event, State) ->
 4854:     {ok, State}.
 4855: 
 4856: handle_info(_Info, State) ->
 4857:     {ok, State}.
 4858: 
 4859: handle_call(_Query, State) -> {ok, {error, bad_query}, State}.
 4860: 
 4861: terminate(_Reason, State) ->
 4862:     State.
 4863: 
 4864: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4865: %%%
 4866: %%% Keep track of started nodes so we can kill them if test
 4867: %%% cases fail to stop them. This typically happens on test case
 4868: %%% failure with peer nodes, and if left might mess up following
 4869: %%% test-cases.
 4870: %%%
 4871: %%% This can be removed when the suite is converted to use CT_PEER.
 4872: %%% This can however at earliest be made in OTP 25.
 4873: %%%
 4874: 
 4875: node_started(Node) ->
 4876:     _ = global_SUITE_node_tracker ! {node_started, Node},
 4877:     ok.
 4878: 
 4879: node_stopped(Node) ->
 4880:     _ = global_SUITE_node_tracker ! {node_stopped, Node},
 4881:     ok.
 4882: 
 4883: start_node_tracker(Config) ->
 4884:     case whereis(global_SUITE_node_tracker) of
 4885:         undefined ->
 4886:             ok;
 4887:         _ ->
 4888:             try
 4889:                 stop_node_tracker(Config),
 4890:                 ok
 4891:             catch
 4892:                 _:_ ->
 4893:                     ok
 4894:             end
 4895:     end,
 4896:     _ = spawn(fun () ->
 4897:                       _ = register(global_SUITE_node_tracker, self()),
 4898:                       node_tracker_loop(#{})
 4899:               end),
 4900:     ok.
 4901: 
 4902: node_tracker_loop(Nodes) ->
 4903:     receive
 4904:         {node_started, Node} ->
 4905:             node_tracker_loop(Nodes#{Node => alive});
 4906:         {node_stopped, Node} ->
 4907:             node_tracker_loop(Nodes#{Node => stopped});
 4908:         stop ->
 4909:             Fact = try 
 4910:                        test_server:timetrap_scale_factor()
 4911:                    catch _:_ -> 1
 4912:                    end,
 4913:             Tmo = 1000*Fact,
 4914:             lists:foreach(
 4915:               fun (N) ->
 4916:                       case maps:get(N, Nodes) of
 4917:                           stopped ->
 4918:                               ok;
 4919:                           alive ->
 4920:                               ct:pal("WARNING: The node ~p was not "
 4921:                                      "stopped by the test case!", [N])
 4922:                       end,
 4923:                       %% We try to kill every node, even those reported as
 4924:                       %% stopped since they might have failed at stopping...
 4925:                       case rpc:call(N, erlang, halt, [], Tmo) of
 4926:                           {badrpc,nodedown} ->
 4927:                               ok;
 4928:                           {badrpc,timeout} ->
 4929:                               ct:pal("WARNING: Failed to kill node: ~p~n"
 4930:                                      "         Disconnecting it, but it may "
 4931:                                      "still be alive!", [N]),
 4932:                               erlang:disconnect_node(N),
 4933:                               ok;
 4934:                           Unexpected ->
 4935:                               ct:pal("WARNING: Failed to kill node: ~p~n"
 4936:                                      "         Got response: ~p~n"
 4937:                                      "         Disconnecting it, but it may "
 4938:                                      "still be alive!", [N, Unexpected]),
 4939:                               erlang:disconnect_node(N),
 4940:                               ok
 4941:                       end
 4942:               end, maps:keys(Nodes))
 4943:     end.
 4944: 
 4945: stop_node_tracker(Config) ->
 4946:     NTRes = case whereis(global_SUITE_node_tracker) of
 4947:                 undefined ->
 4948:                     {fail, missing_node_tracker};
 4949:                 NT when is_port(NT) ->
 4950:                     NTMon = erlang:monitor(port, NT),
 4951:                     exit(NT, kill),
 4952:                     receive {'DOWN', NT, port, NT, _} -> ok end,
 4953:                     {fail, {port_node_tracker, NT}};
 4954:                 NT when is_pid(NT) ->
 4955:                     NTMon = erlang:monitor(process, NT),
 4956:                     NT ! stop,
 4957:                     receive
 4958:                         {'DOWN', NTMon, process, NT, normal} ->
 4959:                             ok;
 4960:                         {'DOWN', NTMon, process, NT, Reason} ->
 4961:                             {fail, {node_tracker_failed, Reason}}
 4962:                     end
 4963:             end,
 4964:     case NTRes of
 4965:         ok ->
 4966:             ok;
 4967:         NTFailure ->
 4968:             case proplists:get_value(tc_status, Config) of
 4969:                 ok ->
 4970:                     %% Fail test case with info about node tracker...
 4971:                     NTFailure;
 4972:                 _ ->
 4973:                     %% Don't fail due to node tracker...
 4974:                     ct:pal("WARNING: Node tracker failure: ~p", [NTFailure]),
 4975:                     ok
 4976:             end
 4977:     end.
